loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise (underwear).

loans.name: Angel

texts.es: El Sr. Ángel es un cliente antiguo pertenecía a un grupo solidario desde el año 2004 el cliente es casado con la señora Martha tiene cuatro hijos  que todos están en la edad escolar,  el Sr. ángel es mecánico, tiene un taller de reparaciones donde le va muy bien en su actividad,  ya que tiene muchos clientes, es conocido por la zona, lleva con esta actividad ya unos 5 años,   solicita el préstamo que destinara para la compra de un horno para su esposa que tiene venta de comida en  el mercado de la zona donde viven, el sr.  Ángel trabaja sacrificadamente desde muy tempranas horas de la madrugada con el propósito de  mejorara económicamente y prosperar.
texts.en:
Sr. Ángel is a longtime client who has been part of a solidarity group since 2004. He is married to Sra. Martha and they have four children who are of school age. Sr. Ángel is a mechanic and has a repair shop that is doing very good business. He has many customers and is well-known in the area. Ángel has been in business for about five years.

He is requesting a loan that will be used to buy an oven for his wife’s business. She sells food at the local market near where they live. Sr. Ángel begins his work sacrificially from the early hours at dawn so that he can improve financially and prosper.

loans.use: to buy an industrial oven for his wife's food business.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is a married woman with 10 children; three of whom attend school while seven have graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 20 years, she has operated a water selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also operates a charcoal selling business which contributes her other source of income. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of transporting charcoal to her place of operation. Salama dreams of educating her children to higher levels of education. 

With the Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es: Felipa es soltera, tiene 3 hijos todos mayores y con su propia familia, tiene 20 años de laborar para la Escuela Normal como inspectora. Esta solicitando su 9no credito para terminar la construccion de la casita de su hija para que tenga mejores condiciones, pues en este momento desea construir un cuarto para contar con mejores condiciones, cuenta con el apoyo de su hija para el pago de las cuotas, ademas tiene ingresos adicionales de su trabajo como costurera. Felipa expresa sentirse muy agradecida por el apoyo brindado por AFODENIC y Kiva, pues gracias a estas instituciones ha podido lograr que su hija se independice con su propia casita.  En la foto doña Felipa aparece con su unica nietecita, la cual vive con ella.
texts.en:
Felipa is single and has three children, all of whom are grown and have their own families. For the past 20 years, she has worked at a teacher’s college as a classroom inspector. Felipa is requesting her ninth loan so that she can finish the construction of her daughter’s house so that it will have better conditions.

At the moment, she wants to build a room that will have the best conditions. Felipa has help from her daughter with making the loan payments. In addition, she earns extra money from her work as a seamstress. Felipa expresses her appreciation for the support AFODENIC and Kiva have provided. Thanks to the help of these institutions, her daughter will be able to live independently in her own home.

In the photograph, Doña Felipa appears with her only granddaughter who lives with her.

loans.use: to build a kitchen in her daughter's house.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
La señora Alejandra tiene 45 años de edad, y es madre soltera de 3 hijos.

Ella cuenta con 7 años de dedicarse a la venta de pupusas (un plato tipico de El Salvador), este negocio lo aprendió de su madre.

Para adquirir los insumos que necesita para elaborar las pupusas, ella se traslada en autobús durante 40 minutos a una ciudad del oriente de país para comprarlos, puesto que ahí los adquiere a mejor precio.

La señora Alejandra esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundación Campo para comprar maíz, fríjol y otros ingredientes que necesita para elaborar las pupusas. Además, ella quiere reparar el lugar donde vende las pupusas ya que actualmente lo hace debajo de una ramada de hojas de plátano, ubicada al otro lado de la calle donde ella vive junto a sus hijos. A pesar de que cuando llueve se moja todo su negocio, el lugar es estratégico para su venta ya que por ahí pasan los autobuses y le compran las personas que viajan a otras ciudades.

Con la ayuda del prestamo ella espera obtener mejores ingresos, para ella y sus hijos logrando tener una seguridad económica para una vida mejor.

En un futuro, la señora Alejandra desea tener una crianza de cerdos y que sus hijos le ayuden para tener otra fuente de ingresos y asi seguir mejorando su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Alejandra is 45 years old and a single mother with three children. For the past seven years, she has been selling “pupusas” (a traditional dish in El Salvador). She learned this trade from her mother.

In order to acquire the supplies needed to make “pupusas”, Alejandra must travel 40 minutes by bus to a city in the eastern part of the country. She buys her products in this area because the prices are better.

Sra. Alejandra is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo to buy corn, beans, and other ingredients needed to make “pupusas”. In addition, she wants to make repairs to the place where she sells her product, which currently consists of an arbor made of banana leaves and is located on the other side of the street where she and her children live. Even though her business gets soaked when it rains, the location is a strategic place for selling since buses pass through that area and people traveling from other cities buy her food.

With the help of this loan, Alejandra hopes to generate more income for herself and her children so that they will have financial security for a better life. In the future, Sra. Alejandra wants to raise pigs and have her children help her so that they will have another source of income. This will help them to continue improving their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase corn, beans, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Kware Group

texts.en:
Hellen is the facilitator of the Kware group. Hellen and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Hellen had a very good maize yield harvesting 14 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Hellen was only able to harvest 8 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from the maize sales, Hellen will invest in a cow and later build a house.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Hellen and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

In 2012, the members of Kware group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the picture above, Kware group is joined by their Field Officer (far left) and many children of Kware group farmers.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Elisée

texts.fr:
Elisée est né au Rwanda et il a 26 ans. Il est célibataire et il prend soin de sa mère. Son niveau d’éducation est 4 ans d’université. 

Elisée est avocat et voudrait aussi faire le taxi voiture. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour lui aider à acheter une taxi voiture. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de mettre le prix de transport adoptable. Dans les prochaines années, Elisée voudrait être transporteur dans le son district ou ailleurs. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer le minerval de ses petits frères.
texts.en:
Elisée was born in Rwanda 26 years ago. He is single and takes care of her mother. He attended university for four years. He's a lawyer and would like to also become a taxi driver.

Elisée is seeking his first loan from Kiva's partner, ACB, in order to help him buy a taxi car. His strategy for growth is to offer affordable taxi ride prices.

In the forthcoming years, he would like to provide transport services in his district or somewhere else. With his profits, he intends to pay the school fees of his younger brothers.

loans.use: to buy a taxi car

loans.name: Jose Trinidad

texts.es:
Jose Trinidad de 33 años de edad es soltero trabaja como psicologo clinico,  y ademas trabaja como docente en una universidad en Nueva Guinea, donde obtiene ingresos adicionales que le permiten apoyar a su familia. 

Esta solicitando su 6to credito para mejorar la casa de su mamá, reparando el techo, piso y puertas que estan en mal estado, pues los fines de semana se va a pasar con ella, y desea que ella cuente con las condiciones necesarias, ya que cuando el y sus hermanos estaban pequeños su mamá les dio lo mejor de ella y quiere retribuirle un poquito el sacrificio que hizo para criarlos.
texts.en:
Jose Trinidad is 33 years old and single.  He works as a clinical psychologist.  In addition, he is a teacher at a university in Nueva Guinea, which enables him to earn extra income to support his family.  

He is requesting his sixth loan so that he can make improvements to his mother’s house.  Jose Trinidad plans to repair the roof, the floor, and the doors which are in poor condition.  On the weekends, he goes to spend time with her and wants her to have the necessary living conditions.  When he and his siblings were little, his mother gave them the best so he wants to give back a little bit in return for the sacrifices she made while raising them.

loans.use: to make repairs to his mother's house.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past three years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transporting goods in her business. Fatuma dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and washing detergents to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and washing detergents to sell.

loans.name: Delmira Del Carmen

texts.es: Delmira trabaja para la educación desde hace 24 años, desempeñandose como  Docente. Esta solicitando  su 4to  credito con el objetivo de poner el piso a su casa y brindarle mayor comodidad a su familia. Cabe señalar que sus creditos los ha utilizado para mejorar poco a poco su casa, sin embargo hasta ahora espera ser beneficiada con kiva.
texts.en:
Delmira has been worked as a teacher for 24 years.  She is requesting her fourth loan so that she can install a floor in her house, thus providing more comfortable conditions for her family.  

It should be noted that the loans have been used to make gradual improvements to her house.  For now, she hopes to be a beneficiary of Kiva.

loans.use: to install a floor in her home.

loans.name: Sorayda Clareth

texts.es: Sorayda Clareth tiene 31 años, su actividad es la venta de cosméticos y ropa nueva. Desde hace más de 6 años que tiene esta actividad económica. El esfuerzo que realiza todos los días por conseguir nuevos clientes, han hecho que su duro trabajo de resultado. El negocio lo aprendió por su Mama que anteriormente ella se hacía cargo del negocio, pero con el paso del tiempo Sorayda decide empezar su propio negocio. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de lápiz labial, polvos, cremas, tratamientos, pinturas de uñas, pintura de labios entre otros.
texts.en:
Sorayda Clareth is 31 years old. Her business involves selling cosmetics and new clothing. She has been in this business for more than six years. The effort she puts forth every day goes toward attracting new customers, which she has been able to do as a result of her hard work. Sorayda learned this trade from her mother since she previously worked at her business. Over time, Sorayda decided to start her own business.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy lip pencils, powders, crèmes, treatments, nail polishes, lipsticks, and other items.

loans.use: to buy lip pencils, powders, crèmes, treatments, nail polishes, lipsticks, and other items.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a married woman with six children, one of whom attends school while five are too old for school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of their family's basic needs. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family. 

She has operated a cereals shop for the past five years, her potential clients are the neighboring locals. She faces a major challenge of transportation. She dreams of establishing a wholesale cereals shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase five bundles of maize flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans.

loans.use: To purchase five bundles of maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years she has operated a juice selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passers-by. Her major challenge is seasonality, especially during rainy season when the demand for fruit juice is lower compared to dry hot season. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fruits and fruit flavours. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fruits and fruit flavours.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: La señora María nacida en la localidad de el Torno-Santa Cruz, no es casada pero convive con el sr. Walter, tienen cuatro hijos, su domicilio es propio que se encuentra ubicado en el barrio 6 de mayo,  viven en la zona hace 24 años,  la Sra. María  tiene como actividad económica la venta alimentos ya sea verduras picadas y cocidas, mote, queso, ají molido, maní molido, etc. en el mercado central de la localidad desde  hace 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad,  el destino del crédito es para la compra de mercadería (maíz, maní, por mayor  y queso). Se siente muy agradecida con la institución por la confianza que se le brindo, es una persona con ganas de superación, siempre luchando por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. María was born in the town of El Torno-Santa Cruz.  She is not married, but lives with Sr. Walter.  They have four children and own a home in the May 6 neighborhood, where they have lived for 24 years.  Sra. María has a business selling food such as pickled and cooked vegetables, stewed corn, cheese, ground ají pepper, ground peanuts, and other specialties at the central market in her town.  She has been in this business for 15 years.  

This loan will be used to buy products such as corn, peanuts, and cheese in bulk.  María is very appreciative of the trust that Emprender has shown to her.  She is a person who has the desire to succeed and always strives to provide for the welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy corn, peanuts, and cheese in bulk.

loans.name: Hormiguitas De Palcoco Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “HORMIGUITAS DE PALCOCO” iniciará su décimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva de la cual la señora Angélica es la presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Tienda de barrio, venta de colchones, venta de comida, venta de cerveza, venta de huevos, venta de carne.

La señora Angélica, indica es la primera ves que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora en la zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración y venta de tullmas (adornos para el trenzado de las mujeres de pollera) que viene trabajando has diez años atrás, aprendiendo el mismo de su mama.

El préstamo que sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de lana y máquina de hilar) que adquirirá de la feria 16 de julio y posterior a la elaboración de sus productos los venderá en las ferias de su comunidad. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Hormiguitas de Palcoco” (Little Ants of Palcoco) is starting its eleventh loan with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Community Center. This group consists of eight members who are led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Angélica, who is the president. The members of this Communal Bank engage in different businesses to get ahead such as managing a neighborhood store, selling bedspreads, selling food, selling beer, selling eggs, and selling meat.

Sra. Angélica says that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer. She joined the organization after being invited by a local promoter. Angélica currently has a business making and selling “tullmas” (decorations for the pleats on women’s skirts) for 10 years. She learned this skill from her mother.

The loan she is receiving will be used to increase her capital for buying wool and a spinning machine that she will acquire at the July 16th fair so that she can make her products to sell at the community fairs. Working in this manner has enabled her to generate income to support her family. Angélica is single and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Angélica said that she enjoys the health classes and the loans.

loans.use: to purchase wool and a spinning machine.

loans.name: Nimia Eliceth

texts.es:
La señora Nimia tiene 43 años de edad, vive en la comunidad El Caimito de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, ahi vive con sus tres hijos, Nimia es madre soltera y se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulpieria ubicada en su casa de habitacion. Nimia a luchado sola para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
Sus clientes son los vecinos de la comunidad su negocio abre de lunes a domingo.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria para surtir su negocio.
Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Sra. Nimia is 43 years old and resides in the community of El Caimito in the city of San Lorenzo. She lives with her three children. Nimia is a single mother and sells popular consumer products. She has a store located in her home. Working alone, Nimia strives to move forward on behalf of her children. Her customers consist of neighbors from the community. She is open for business Monday through Sunday.

This loan will be used to buy merchandise to restock her business. Her dream is to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Larry Luis

texts.es: Larry de 34 años de edad soltero, labora para un ministerio desde hace 14 años como Conductor. Esta solicitando su 7mo.  credito con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda realizando la construccion de un cuarto y asi brindarle a su familia mejores comodidades.  Cabe señalar que el credito anterior lo utilizo para mejorar su casa poniendole el piso y fue beneficiado por kiva, ahora espera que nuevamente le apoye para realizar su proyecto.
texts.en:
Larry is 34 years old, single, and has worked for 14 years as a driver.  He is requesting his seventh loan so that he can make an improvement to his home.  Larry will build a room so that he can provide more comfortable conditions for his family.  

It should be noted that his previous loan was used to improve his home by installing a floor, which was a benefit of being funded by Kiva.  Now he hopes to renew this support so that he can complete this project.

loans.use: to build a room.

loans.name: Josué

texts.es:
Josué presidente del grupo del Banco comunal “Fondo Amigo” perteneciente a la localidad de Villa Alemana. Se dedica al rubro del comercio desde hace 10 años, específicamente vendiendo ropa en la feria, atendiendo un bazar – paquetería en un kiosco que tiene ubicado en su casa y preparando comida rápida.
Desde sus inicios le ha ido muy bien y su clientela es fija. Su horario de trabajo es de martes a domingo. Con las ganancias de los negocios ha remodelado la infraestructura de su kiosco, para obtener el permiso de salubridad, de ésta manera vender sus preparaciones de comida rápida sin restricciones. 
Con el crédito comprará un horno industrial, una plancha para preparar churrascos y una freidora, para su negocio de comida rápida. 
Sus metas en su negocio son prosperar e invertir en un vehículo para trasladar su mercadería. 
Josué vive junto a su madre, sus anhelos son brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su madre. 
El está muy contento y agradecido de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, comenta que el grupo en el cual participa es unido y comprometido. 
Con las capacitaciones realizadas en las reuniones del grupo ha aprendido a administrar de mejor manera su negocio, ya que ahora lleva un registro de sus ingresos y gastos. 
Villa Alemana es una comuna ubicada en la provincia de Marga Marga, región de Valparaíso, zona central de Chile. Es conocida como la "ciudad de los molinos", por la gran cantidad de casas quinta que necesitaban sacar agua a través de molinos. 
También se la conoce como la “Ciudad de la Eterna Juventud”, por su clima templado, muy benigno, que la caracteriza de la siguiente manera "por su clima, la juventud no teme a la vejez. La vejez en Villa Alemana vive en eterna juventud".
texts.en:
Josué is president of his group in the "Fondo Amigo" Communal Bank, which takes place in the neighborhood of Villa Alemana.  He has been working in retail for the last ten years, specifically selling clothes at the market, tending to a stationery store and parcel-delivery service from a kiosk in his home, and preparing fast food.

Things have been going very well for him since the start, and his customers are loyal.  His work schedule is from Tuesday through Sunday.  With the earnings from his businesses, he has remodeled his kiosk's infrastructure so as to obtain a health permit; this means he can sell his fast food without any restrictions.

With the loan, he will buy an industrial oven, a grill for cooking steaks, and a fryer for his fast food business.  His goals are for his business to prosper, and to invest in a vehicle for transporting his merchandise.
 
Josué lives with his mother; his hope is to provide a better quality of life for her.

He is very happy and appreciative about the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza has provided to him.  He comments that his group is united and committed.  From the trainings that take place at the group meetings, he has learned how to manage his business in a better way; he now keeps a register of his income and expenses.

Villa Alemana is a community located in the province of Marga Marga, in the Valparaíso region in the central part of Chile.  It is known as the "city of the mills", because of the large number of country homes that need to get water by means of mills.  It is also known as the "City of Eternal Youth", for its temperate and pleasant climate, which is reflected in the following saying: " because of its climate, the young people are not afraid to grow old.  The old people in Villa Alemana live in eternal youth."

loans.use: to buy an industrial oven, a grill for cooking steaks, and a fryer for his fast-food business.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years she has operated a beauty salon business, and her potential customers are neighbours, especially women. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. During festive season she gets lots of customers in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase hair chemicals for use in her beauty salon. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase hair chemicals for use in her beauty salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To install tap water for a water distribution business.

loans.name: Llane

texts.es:
Llane tiene 34 años, se considera como una mujer responsable y trabajadora, es casada y madre de tres hijos de 17, 12 y 3 años, por quienes se esmera por darles una buena educación. Juntos habitan en su casa propia. 
El trabajo al que se dedica es la venta de variados productos a domicilio, entre ellos: detergentes, jabones, lejía y otros artículos de limpieza; asimismo ofrece queso, mermeladas; postres como, pionono, alfajores, king kong (postre típico del norte), de acuerdo a la solicitud de cliente. Desde entonces recorre las calles para llegar a la casa de familiares, amistades, quienes son sus más fieles compradores. Pero antes de comenzar con esta faena muy agitada, ella primero se dedica a su hogar durante la mañana, ya por la tarde es que empieza con ésta labor. Su sistema de pago es dejar a crédito los producto y al cabo de un tiempo se dedica solo a cobrar. 
Para ella le es muy práctico éste trabajo, por la facilidad del tiempo que dispone así no descuida de sus hijos y puede ayudarlos con las tareas del colegio. Sin embargo el tener que caminar mucho a veces le resulta muy agotado, pero sabe que éste sacrificio lo vale si desea ver a sus hijos profesionales. Pero ahora lo que más desea es ampliar su negocio y empezar con la venta de ropa, para ello deberá traer mercadería de la ciudad de Lima, que es donde lo puede conseguir a menor precio. Este será el crédito número diez con MFP, por lo que asegura cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado, comprará más productos de limpieza y además comprará ropa.
texts.en:
Llane is 34 years old and is known as a responsible and hardworking woman. She is married and the mother of three children aged 17, 12 and 3 years old, and she works hard to give them a good education. Together they live in their own house. 

The work she does is selling household products including: detergents, soaps, bleach, and other cleaning products. She also sells cheese and jams as well as desserts like swiss rolls, sandwich cookies, and king kong (local dish from the north) according to her client’s request. She then walks the streets to go to her friend’s and families houses, her most loyal customers. But before starting with this very busy task, she first does housework in the morning and then in the afternoon she does her job. Her payment system is to run a credit and within some time to collect. 

For her this job is very practical because of the flexible schedule it provides she doesn’t neglect her children and she can help them with their school homework. Without a doubt, the need to walk a lot at times makes her very tired, but she knows that this sacrifice is worth it if she wants to see her children become professionals. But now what she wants more is to grow her business and begin to sell clothes, and to do that she must get merchandise from Lima which is where she can find a lower price. This will be the 10th loan with MFP and so she promises to comply with the repayment terms. With the amount asked for, she will buy more cleaning products and also she will buy clothes.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products and clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy beans, tortillas, lard, oil, eggs, flour, bread, coffee, batteries, candles, instant soups, pastry, softdrinks, soap, sweets and balls.

loans.name: Emprendedoras De Casa Huerta Group

texts.es: Karina es integrante de la Alcancía Comunal “Emprendedores de Casa Huerta” grupo que está conformado por 07 socios  entre hombres y mujeres entusiastas y honrados. Karina tiene 25 años de edad  es soltera, y solo vive con su padre, la cual  ha sido su motivo para superarse en la vida. Ella se dedica al servicio domestico anteriormente cuidaba un anciano, es de esa manera como se ha desempeñado, con el fin de querer mejorar busco otro trabajo la cual le ofrecían mayores ingresos, es por ello que  hace 06 meses  se dedica al cuidado de 1 niña. Es así como  Karina a su corta edad ha tenido que trabajar arduamente para que pueda  salir adelante, actualmente sus ingresos cubren algunos gastos del hogar y también los ahorra ya que va a empezar a  estudiar costura. El deseo de Karina es de poner un taller de costura en su domicilio, la cual brindara trabajo a otras personas ya que necesitará mano de obra. Con el crédito solicitado lo va utilizar para sus gastos del hogar  comprando arroz, azúcar, leche y fideos, pues comprando al por mayor le sale económico. La Alcancía Comunal “Emprendedores de Casa Huerta” agradecen la ayudad brindada. Olga no pudo estar presente por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en:
Karina is a member of the Communal Bank group “Emprendedores de Casa Huerta”, which is made up of seven members, who are enthusiastic and honorable men and women.

Karina is 25 years old.  She is single and lives with her father, who has been her motivation for succeeding in life.  She works in domestic services.  She used to work taking care of an elderly man, but had the goal of wanting to improve her life, and so looked for other work that would provide her with better income.  This is why six months ago, she started working looking after a little girl.  

Even at her young age, Karina has had to work hard to be able to move ahead in life.  Currently her income covers some of the household expenses, and she is also saving as she wants to begin to study tailoring.  Karina's dream is to be able to have a sewing workshop in her home, where she can provide work for other people who need employment.

With the requested loan, she will be able to cover her household expenses by buying rice, sugar, milk and noodles.  She will buy them at wholesale, since it is cheaper.

The “Emprendedores de Casa Huerta” Communal Bank is grateful for the help being offered.    

Note that Olga could not be present for the photo because of work.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and noodles.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La señora Georgia tiene 51 años, está casada y tiene 4 hijos, ellos viven en la ciudad D. Caacupé.
Es comerciante desD. hace más D. 10 años, empezó vendiendo primeramente bebidas, como gaseosas y cervezas, con el pequeño ahorro y la ayuda D. su hijo que es chofer D. una empresa importadora D. vehículos pudo llegar a surtir su negocio con otro tipo D. productos hasta finalmente montar una despensa.
Gracias a la buena atención y a la calidad D. sus productos hoy día tiene clientela formada. La Señora Georgia comenta que sus ingresos son muy buenos y sus ventas aumentan ya que cumple con la demanda D. los productos que su clientela requiere.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. comestibles, bebidas,panificados y otros, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y tener más variedad D. productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Georgia, 51, is married and has four children.  They live in the city of Caacupé.

For over ten years she has been in business and started out selling beverages such as sodas and beer.  With a small amount of savings and help from her son, who is a driver for a vehicle import company, she was able to stock more products until finally establishing a store.

Nowadays she has a well formed customer base thanks to her service and product quality.  Mrs. Georgia says she has a very good income and sale are increasing because she is able to meet customer demand.

She is requesting a loan to buy goceries, beverages, bakery products and other items which will add variety to the range of products she offers her customers.

loans.use: To buy groceries, beverages, bakery products and other items.

loans.name: Francisca Matilde

texts.es: Francisca Matilde tiene 45 años,  su actividad es la venta de nacatamales y leña. El tiempo que tiene realizando este negocio es de 2 años. Tiene 2 hijos menores de edad que están bajo su cargo. Ella solicita este crédito con el objetivo de comprar cerdos y leña, para posteriormente realizar los nacatamales. Ella siempre ha sido una persona luchadora y que disfruta de realizar este trabajo constantemente.
texts.en: Francisca Matilde, 45, has been selling nacatamales (typical steamed meat wrapped in banana leaves or corn husks) and firewood.  Francisca Matilde has 2 young children.  She is requesting a loan to buy pigs and firewood so that she can make the nacatamales.  She is a born fighter who always enjoys her work.

loans.use: To buy pigs and firewood

loans.name: Ana Tulia

texts.es:
Ana es una emprendedora que siempre soñó con crear su propio negocio desD. su casa, una tienda en la que ofrece a sus vecinos productos D. la canasta familiar, la tienda está ubicada en su propia casa lo que le permite estar pendiente del hogar y D. sus  7 hijos. 

Ana necesita D. un préstamo para comprar productos generales para surtir la tienda, los cuales son D. gran demanda por parte D. sus clientes, pues es conciente que así mejorará sus ventas, y su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Ana is an entrepreneur who always dreamed of creating her own business in her home. She has a store where she sells everyday household products to her neighbors.  The store is located in her home, which allows her to be available for her household and for her seven children.

Ana needs a loan to buy general merchandise to stock up her store, things which are in great demand by her customers.  She knows that in this way she can improve her sales and her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy items to stock up her store.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
El señor Lucio tiene 61 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus 5 hijos.

Don Lucio es un hombre muy luchador que ha trabajado desde los 8 años de edad. Fue su padre quien le enseñó primeramente el oficio de la alfarería (elaboración de ladrillos de barro, tejas, etc). A la edad de 25 años de edad, Don Lucio contrae matrimonio con su actual esposa.  Desde entonces él le lleva el sustento a su familia por medio de la agricultura. Fue así que poco a poco Don Lucio y su esposa han logrado tener un pedacito de tierra en donde cultivan. El terreno está ubicado a dos kilómetros y medio de su casa. Para llegar ahí solo lo pueden hacer a pie, caminando por veredas angostas en donde hay arbustos espinosos.Cuando ya tiene la cosecha, Don Lucio carga el maiz en su espalda para llevarlo hasta su casa, cruzando todas las veredas. Luego, él lleva el maiz en una carreta o en bus a venderlo en el pueblo más cercano. Todo este esfuerzo él lo hace con amor para su familia ya que es de esta forma como él puede llevarles el sustento diario. Don Lucio se levanta todos los días a las 4:00 de la mañana y termina a las 8:00 p.m. Cada año, Don Lucio almacena una parte de su cosecha en graneros y eso le sirve como materia prima para el siguiente año. Por esta razón, él no tiene que comprar la semilla para sembrar, aunque si tiene que comprar fertilizantes, herbicidas y pesticidas.

Para seguir trabajando, Don Lucio está solicitando un préstamo a Fundación Campo para la compra de fertilizantes, pesticidas y herbicidas para la cosecha de maíz; y también para la compra de árboles de chile guaco. El quiere sembrar chile en el terreno de su casa para así tener un ingreso adicional con la venta de los chiles. 

Con respecto al beneficio del préstamo, Don Lucio manifiesta con sus propias palabras lo siguiente: “tendré el pan de cada día, tendré vestuario para mi familia, tendré salud y amor en el hogar por la satisfacción de que el préstamo ayudo a realizar mi objetivo y que Fundación Campo siempre ayuda al más pobre.”

El deseo de Don Lucio es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. El quiere que sus hijos tengan un buen ejemplo de sus padres. El quiere que sus hijos aprendan que con esfuerzo y dedicación se puede vencer cualquier obstáculo, por muy difícil que parezca, y que la mejor forma de ganarse la vida es trabajando.
texts.en:
Señor Lucio is 61 years old, and lives with his wife and five children.

Don Lucio is a very hard-working man, who has been working since he was 8 years old.  It was his father who first taught him how to work in pottery (making mud bricks, tiles, etc.)  At the age of 25, Don Lucio married his current wife.  Since then, he has supported his family by means of agriculture.  Little by little, Don Lucio and his wife have been able to get a small piece of land which they cultivate.  The land is located two and a half kilometers from their home, and can only be reached on foot by walking through narrow paths with thorn bushes. When it's harvest time, Don Lucio carries the corn on his shoulders along the paths to bring it back to his home.  Then he brings the corn in a cart or on a bus to a village that's very close by, where he sells it.  He makes all this effort out of love for his family, and in this way he is able to provide them with their daily bread.

Don Lucio gets up at 4 a.m. every day, and finishes working at 8:00 p.m.  Every year, Don Lucio stores a part of his harvest in the granary, and uses it as starting material for the following year.  For this reason, he doesn't need to buy seeds for sowing, although he still needs to buy fertilizers, herbicides, and pesticides.

To continue with his work, Don Lucio is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo for the purchase of fertilizers, pesticides and herbicides for his corn crop, and also to purchase guaco chili plants.  He wants to grow chili peppers on the land belonging to his home, so that he can earn some additional income from the sale of the chili peppers.

In regards to the benefits of the loan, Don Lucio states the following in his own words: "I will have daily food, I will have clothing for my family, I will have health and love in my household, with the satisfaction of knowing that the loan has helped me to achieve my goal and that Fundación Campo always helps the poorest people."

Don Lucio's desire is to improve his family's quality of life.  He wants his children to see their parents as a good example.  He wants his children to learn that with effort and dedication they can overcome any obstacle, as difficult as things may seem, and that the best way to earn a living is through work.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and guaco chili plants.

loans.name: Lilian Jeaneth

texts.es:
Lilian Jeaneth tiene 22 años de edad, vive con su esposo y su hija, Lilian se dedica desde hace un año a elaborar tamales y golosinas, sus comidas las prepara todos los días por las mañanas y por las tardes sale a vender junto con su esposo a los caseríos y comunidades aledañas, sus ventas son ambulantes y trabaja de lunes a domingo, Lilian utilizara el credito para la compra de alimentos para preparar sus deliciosas golosinas y sus sabrosos tamales.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Lilian Jeaneth is 22 years old and lives with her husband and daughter.  She has been making tamales and sweet treats for one year.  She prepares her products every morning and, in the afternoons, she goes out with her husband to sell them in the neighboring villages and communities.  She makes her sales as an itinerant vendor and works from Monday to Sunday.

Lilian will use this loan to buy food with which to prepare her delicious sweet treats and her tasty tamales.  Her dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: to buy corn, fat, oil, vegetables, beef, pork, chicken, beans, butter, tortillas, cheese, eggs and seasonings

loans.name: Martín Dario

texts.es:
El Señor Martín tiene 34 años actualmente vive en la ciudad de Carapeguá. El se desempeña como albañil profesional y esta trabajando por cuenta propia. Martín aprendió el oficio en la Argentina donde estuvo trabajando durante cinco años, con un tío, luego se murió su madre y vino a quedarse en su país.
Actualmente esta construyendo una casa y cuentas con mucho trabajos por que su especialidad es la terminación como molduras, colocación de azulejos en baños y pisos, ahora esta trabajando con él su sobrino a quien le enseña la profesión y la vez les paga por los servicios.
El solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas herramientas de trabajo, como ser baldes, cucharas de albañilería y otros. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Martín is 34 years old and currently lives in the city of Carapeguá.  He is a professional builder and is self employed.  Martín learned the trade in Argentina where he worked for five years with his uncle.  Then his mother died and he came back home to Paraguay.

Martín is currently building a house and he has a lot of work because his speciality is finishing work such as moldings, laying tiles in bathrooms and also on floors.  He is now working with his nephew to whom he is teaching the profession and, at the same time, paying him for his services.

Martín is requesting this loan to buy more work tools such as buckets, trowels, etc.  He is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity that they are giving him.

loans.use: to buy work tools

loans.name: Maxima Audely

texts.es: Máxima Audely tiene 45 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 13 años que tiene este negocio, todos los días enfrenta retos diferentes, esto no la desanima para salir adelante con su negocio. La mayoría de sus clientes siempre le están solicitando variedad en sus productos, y es por medio de los financiamientos que ella ha podido realizarlos. Es por eso que solicita este crédito para la compra de calzado, bolsos, perfumes, ropa en general, entre otros.
texts.en: Máxima Audely is 45 years old. Her work is selling general merchandise. She has had this business for more than 13 years. Every day she faces different challenges, but this does not discourage her from moving forward with her business. Most of her customers are constantly asking her for variety in her products, and it is thanks to the loans that she has been able to satisfy them. For the same reason, she is requesting this loan, to buy shoes, purses, perfumes, and clothing in general, among other items.

loans.use: to buy shoes, purses, perfumes, and clothing in general, among other items.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
La señora Flor es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Productivas del Distrito Manantay, Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y tres hijos mayores.
Se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir y lo realiza en su propia casa, ha implementado un pequeño taller y cuenta con máquinas que le facilitan su trabajo para dar un mejor acabado a sus prendas.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles comprará: 5 kilos de licra, 4 kilos de algodón, 10 metros de blondas, 2 conos de hilos.
Las prendas que confecciona las vende a un precio módico porque sus clientes son personas de bajos ingresos, pero aun así está obteniendo ganancias en cada una de las prendas, también recibe trabajos de costuras (composturas).
Ella vive sola con su esposo, él es trabajador independiente y lo que ganan es suficiente para ellos dos y para los gastos fijos de la casa, ya educaron a sus hijos y eso les da mucha tranquilidad.
texts.en:
Sra. Flor is a member of the Mujeres Productivas communal bank in Manatay district, Ucayali department. She is 49 years old, married and has three adult children. She makes clothing in her own home. She set up a small workshop and relies on machines that facilitate her work and give her garments a better finish.

With her new loan of 1,500 nuevos soles, she will buy 5 kilos of lycra, 4 kilos of cotton, 10 meters of lace and 2 cones of thread. 

She sells the garments she makes very reasonably because her customers earn low wages, nevertheless she makes a profit from each item she sells. In addition, she also does mending. 

She lives alone with her husband. He is self employed and earns enough for the two of them and for fixed household expenses, since they have already educated their children and that gives them great peace of mind.

loans.use: to buy fabric, cotton, lace.

loans.name: Jesus Del Pilar

texts.es:
La señora Jesús socia del banco comunal Mujeres Productivas del Distrito Manantay, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 33 años de edad,está casada y tiene cuatro hijos.
Se dedica a la compra y venta de madera en cuartones y lo realiza en su misma casa porque vive en la zona industrial, ahí mismo almacena toda su madera.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/.  1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará 15 tablones de madera aserrada.

Para trabajar con madera se necesita un buen capital, pero como no cuenta con más capital, está comprando  poco a poco y con las ventas sigue invirtiendo.
Su esposo es maestro afilador y trabaja en un aserradero, ella es la que se queda en su casa para atender su negocio y también a sus hijos, gracias por lo que a logrado con su trabajo y quiere seguir trabajando por mucho más tiempo con Manuela Ramos para mejorar su vida y la de su familia.
En la foto se muestra con uno de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jesus is a member of the “Mujeres Productivas” (Productive Women) communal bank of Manantay district, Ucayali depatment. She is 33 years old, married, and has 4 children.

She buys and sells dressed timber and she is able to do so in her own house because she lives in the industrial zone where she stores all her lumber.

With her new loan of 1,000 new sols she will buy 15 sawed beams.

To work with lumber, one needs a good amount of capital but since she can't count on more capital, she is buying little by little, and with her sales she continues to invest.

Jesus' husband is a master saw blade sharpener who works in a saw mill. Jesus is the one who remains at home to attend to business and also, the children. For this reason, she has advanced her business and wants to continue working much longer with Manuela Ramos [a micro-finance institution], in order to improve her life and that of her family.

In the photo, she appears with one of her children.

loans.use: to buy lumber to sell.

loans.name: G.s. Dios Nos Guia Group

texts.es: Ángela Mercedes y María Concepción conforman el grupo solidario Dios Nos Guía. Ángela tiene 32 años, su actividad es la venta y elaboración de dulces. Hace más de 6 años que tiene este negocio. Uno de sus desafíos es que los precios de los productos necesaR. para la elaboración de los diferentes dulces son muy caros. Pero le resulta beneficioso, para las ganancias necesarias de su hogar. El financiamiento es para la compra leche, coco, dulce, azúcar, maní, entre otros.
texts.en: Ángela Mercedes and María Concepción make up the communal bank "Dios Nos Guia."  Angela is 32 years old, and she has a business making and selling sweets.  She has had this business for more than 6 years.  One of her challenges is that the products that she needs to make her various sweets are very expensive.  But her business gives her good results; it gives her the earnings she needs for her household.  This loan will be used to buy milk, cocoa, candy, sugar, peanuts and other items.

loans.use: to buy milk, cocoa, candy, sugar, peanuts and other ingredients

loans.name: Concepcion Rosario

texts.es:
La señora  Concepcion Rosario tiene 56 años de edad, vive en el Barrio Nuevo Vista Centro de la ciudad de San Lorenzo y se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pulperia ubicada en su casa de habiracion, desde hace 7 se dedica a este tipo de actividad, ahi vende a sus vecinos y amigos, tambien vende charamuscas las cuales se lo administra un nieto, Concepcion temprano deja preparadas las charamuscas en su refrigerador para luego ser vendidas.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria para surtir su negocio y asi obtener mayores ganancias.
Su meta es tener su negocio bien surtido donde pueda vender todo tipo de productos.
texts.en:
Concepcion Rosario is 56 years old. She lives in the Nuevo Vista neighborhood in the center of the town of San Lorenzo. She sells products for daily consumption in her small store located in her home. She has done this activity for 7 years, selling to her neighbors and friends. She also sells charamuscas (candy twists), which her grandson manages. Concepción makes the charamuscas early in the day and leaves them in her refrigerator to be sold later on.  

She will use the loan to buy groceries to stock her business and thus make more income. Her goal is to have a well stocked business where she can sell all types of products.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, rice, sugar, lard, milk, margarine, soups, pastas. sauces, salt, condiments, juices, beverages, churros, bread, coffee, cookies, candles and gas.

loans.name: Jenny Luz

texts.es:
La señora Jenny es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Productivas del Distrito Manantay del Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y tiene una hija menor.
Lleva varios años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas gaseosas, lleva ya un buen tiempo en este negocio.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles  comprará: 10 jabas de gaseosas de diferentes sabores, 3 paquetes de gaseosas de 3 litros, 2 paquetes de gaseosa de 2.5 litros, 2 paquetes de agua mineral.
Tiene que tener gaseosas de deferentes sabores y  tamaños porque sus clientes así lo piden, su casa está cerca de los aserraderos y tiene muchos clientes quienes consumen sus productos.
Su esposo trabaja manejando motocar (transporte) y es el que le ayuda cuando tiene que hacer sus compras, solo tiene una hija, esperan darle una buena educación, por ello se esfuerzan cada día.
texts.en:
Jenny is a member of the Mujeres Productivas (Productive Women) Communal Bank in the Manantay district in the Ucayali department.  She is 32 years old, married, and has a daughter who is a minor.

She has been working with loans from Manuela Ramos for several years.  She sells soft drinks.  She has been in this business for a good amount of time.

With her new loan for 1,000 soles she will buy ten crates of different flavors of soft drinks, three packages of three liter size soft drinks, two packages of two and a half liter size soft drinks, and two packages of mineral water.

She needs to have different flavors and sizes of soft drinks because that is what her customers ask for.  Her house is near the saw mill, and she has a lot of customers who consumer her products.

Her husband works driving a “motocar” (transportation).  He is the one that helps her when she has to make her purchases.  She only has one daughter, and they hope to give her a good education.  That is why they put forth their efforts every day.

loans.use: to buy wholesale soft drinks.

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.es:
La señora Lucinda es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Productivas del Distrito Manantay, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 3 hijos mayores e independientes, ella está casada.
Lleva trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos desde hace tres años y se dedica a la agricultura, tiene una chacra donde invierte todo su préstamo para la siembra de hortalizas, que luego trae a vender al mercado de la ciudad
Con su nuevo préstamo S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: ½ kilo de  semilla de tomate, ½ kilo de semilla de culantro, ½ kilo de semilla de col, 2 kilos de semilla de frejol, ½ kilo de semilla de vainitas, 2 kilos de semilla de maíz, 2 kilos de semilla de maní.
Son productos que la gente de este lugar utiliza diariamente en sus comidas, según el tiempo llega a tener un buen precio y eso es lo que aprovechan los agricultores, de esa manera sienten que su trabajo es recompensado.
Lucinda agradece a Manuela Ramos por todo el apoyo brindado a las mujeres que quieren sacar adelante a sus sfamilias.
texts.en:
Sra. Lucinda is a member of Mujeres Productivas in Manantay district, Ucayali department. She has three grown children, who are self-supporting, and she is married.

She has been receiving loans from Manuela Ramos/CrediMUJER for three years and is a farmer, who beings her crops to market in the city. 

With her new loan of 1,000 nuevo soles, she will buy ½ kilo of tomato seeds, ½ kilo of cilantro seed, ½ kilo of cabbage seed, 2 kilos of bean seed, ½ kilo of snap bean seeds, 2 kilos of corn seed and 2 kilos of peanut seed. These are products that people in the area use daily in their meals. Depending on the weather, such crops can earn a good price and that is what the farmers try to profit from. In this way, they feel that their work is rewarded. 

Lucinda is grateful to Manuela Ramos/CrediMUJER for all the help provided women who want to help their families get ahead.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Marlene tiene 41 años, se destaca por ser una mujer muy dinámica y trabajadora, convive con su pareja y el menor de sus hijos, pues los tres ya son mayores e independientes. Juntos habitan en su casa que es propia. Su fin es dar lo mejor de si para mejorar su calidad de vida y progresar, por tanto trabaja en el mercado central de su ciudad, ahí posee una tienda de venta de abarrotes y productos variados. Tiene un año ejerciendo éste negocio, y aún desea seguir continuando para consolidarse como comerciante, por ello trata siempre de exhinir la cantidad de mercaderái que tiene, así sus clientes no dejan de comprarle. Ella espera mas adelante ampliar su tienda y surtirla con más productos. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para continaur con su trabajo. Con el monto solicitado, comprará más mercadería en productos de primera necesidad y así cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en: Marlene is 41 years old, and stands out as a very dynamic and hardworking woman.  She lives with her partner and the youngest of her children, as three of her children are already adults and are independent.  Her family lives together in their own house.  Her goal is to do her best to improve her quality of life and make progress. She works in the central market of her city, where she has a store where she sells groceries and a variety of products.  She has been running this store for a year, and she wants to continue to establish herself as a merchant.  To do this she tries to always exhibit all of her merchandise, so that her customers will not stop buying.  She hopes in the future to expand her store and stock it with more products.  This will be her first loan with MFP, and so she awaits the support of each of you so that she can continue with her work.  With the sum requested, she will buy more merchandise in the form of basic consumer goods, so that in this way she can meet the demand from her customers.

loans.use: to buy basic consumer goods

loans.name: Sugeyda Arely

texts.es:
La señora Sugeyda Arely tiene 34 años de edad, vive en la colonia 18 de Diciembre de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, Sugeyda es madre  soltera y tiene tres hijos, dos ellos estudian en el colegio. Sugeyda se dedica a la venta de abarroteria, es una mujer trabajadora y gracias a su esfuerzo a logrado salir adelante con sus hijos.
También parte de su tiempo libre lo dedica a estudiar a distancia, ella se quiere graduar de administradora de empresas.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria, desea comprar mas productos para así vender mas y obtener mejores ganancias.    

Su meta es tener la mejor pulpería de la zona
texts.en:
Sugeyda Arely is 34 years old. She lives in the 18 de Diciembre neighborhood of the city of San Lorenzo. Sugeyda is a single mother and has three children. Two of them are in high school. Sugeyda sells groceries. She is a hardworking woman and thanks to her efforts she has been able to get ahead with her children. 

She also does distance learning in her free time. She wants to get a degree in business management. She will use the loan to buy groceries. She wants more products To be able to sell more and make more income. Her goal is to have the best store in the area.

loans.use: to buy creams, deodorants, shampoos, conditioners, toothpastes, hair gel, and general groceries.

loans.name: Vy'a Renda Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue la señora Victoria quién  invito y organizo a sus amigas y vecinas del barrio para formar parte del programa Comité D. Mujeres Emprendedoras D. la Fundación. Ellas se unieron con el propósito D. generar mayores ingresos para sus familias, ya que desean poder brindarles siempre lo mejor.
La señora Victoria, una D. las miembros, esta separada hace un año, tiene una hija con capacidades diferentes. La señora se dedica a la costura, comenta que gracias a este trabajo ella pueD. mantener su casa, su taller y también a su hija. En cuanto a su clientela comenta que tiene mucha, ya que es muy conocida en el barrio por el buen trabajo que ella hace.
Victoria retiro el credito para la compra D. una maquina D. coser y otros materiales para su trabajo. Ella tiene como meta abrir un taller D. costura dentro D. su casa, y así ir mejorando el ingreso D. su familia y satisfacer sus necesidades básicas.
texts.en:
Victoria was the first to start this committee: she invited and organized her friends and neighbors to become a part of Fundación Paraguaya’s Mujeres 
Emprendedoras program. They got together in order to earn better incomer for their families, as they want to always offer the best to them.
Victoria is a founding member of the group. She separated from her husband one year ago, and she has a daughter who has special needs. She is a seamstress and she told us that thanks to this activity she has been able to maintain her house, her workshop and to support her daughter as well. As for customers, she says she has many, as she is very well-known in her neighborhood thanks to the good quality of her job.
Victoria has asked for a loan to buy a sewing machine and other materials for her job. Her dream is to set a sewing workshop in her house, in order to keep on improving her family’s income and to satisfy their basic necessities.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for her workshop.

loans.name: Nimia

texts.es:
La señora Nimia es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Productivas del Distrito Manantay, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y tiene 5 hijos.
Se dedica a la venta de repuestos de carro, su negocio aun es pequeño, recién cuenta con una pequeña vitrina que está abasteciendo poco a poco, pero dice que "por algo se empieza".
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles comprará: ½ docena de pistones, ½ docena de crucetas, 1 caja de bujías, 6 pares de espejos, 1 balde de grasa, ½ docena de radiadores.
Le falta mayor inversión pero está empezando con poco capital, mas adelante espera tener una tienda bien completa, es la meta que se a trazado este año, solo espera que Manuela Ramos le sigua prestando el apoyo económico que necesita para implementar mas su negocio.
A su cargo tiene un solo hijo que todavía está estudiando y necesita mucho de su apoyo.  Su esposo es operador de maquinas pesadas.
texts.en:
Nimia is a member of the communal bank Mujeres Productivas in the district of Manantay, in the department of Ucayali, and is 41 years old, married and has 5 children. She has an auto parts store. Her business is small and she has a little showcase that she is supplying little by little, because as she says, "everybody has to begin somewhere." With her new loan of 1500 soles she will buy 1/2 dozen pistons, 1/2 dozen spreaders, 1 box of spark plugs, 6 pairs of mirrors, a bucket of grease, and 1/2 dozen radiators.

The major problem was beginning with a small investment but as time goes by she will have a more complete store. She is on the path to this goal this year. She only hopes that Manuela Ramos continues to provide the loans that she needs to grow her business. She has one dependent child in school needing support. Her husband is a heavy equipment operator.

loans.use: to purchase radiators, pistons, and other auto parts for resale

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru:
Наталья живет на востоке Украины, в городе Никополе. У нее есть муж и трое взрослых детей, которые живут отдельно. Наталья торгует женской одеждой и обувью. Товар, который предлагает Наталья в своем магазинчике, больше эксклюзивный и добротный, не совсем дешевый, тем не менее, Наталья имеет своих постоянных покупателей. Шестнадцать лет назад Наталья начинала с торговли туалетными водами, а потом решила перейти на тот товар, на котором больше накрутка и стала торговать женской одеждой и обувью. На данный момент у нее в товаре около 100 000 гривен. 

Кредит в 15 000 гривен Наталья планирует вложить в закупку дополнительного количества одежды и обуви, чтобы пополнить осенний и зимний ассортимент. Благодаря успешному ведению бизнеса Наталья смогла приобрести квартиры всем своим троим детям. Заёмщица планирует и дальше развивать свою торговлю, пока хватит сил. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Natalya lives in east of Ukraine, in the town of Nikopol.  She has a husband and three grown children, who live separately.  Natalya sells women's clothing and shoes.  The merchandise, that Natalya offers in her store, is more exclusive and of high quality, and not cheap.  She has loyal customers.  Ntalya started her business 16 years ago with the sales of Eu De Toilette and then decided to transition to merchandise that has the most add-on, and started to sell women's clothing and shoes.  Currently, she her merchandise is valued at 100 000 hryvnia.  Natalya plans to use the 15 000 hryvnia loan to purchase an additional inventory of clothing and shoes, in order to add to her fall and winter assortments.  Thanks to the success of her business, Natalya was able to buy apartments for all of her three children.  She plans to further develop her sales business, while she has strength to do so.

loans.use: to purchase an additional inventory of clothing and shoes, in order to add to her fall and winter assortments

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita integrante y tesorera del grupo del Banco comunal “Fondo Amigo” perteneciente a la localidad de Villa Alemana. 
Se dedica al rubro del comercio desde hace 9 años, ha dedicado su tiempo a atender y vender mercadería en un negocio que tiene ubicado en su misma casa. Ahí ofrece verduras, abarrotes y un poco de artesanía en madera (decoupage) que ella misma realiza.
Su horario de trabajo es a partir de las 8ºº de la mañana hasta las 9ºº de la noche, todos los días de la semana, su marido es quien la ayuda en la atención del negocio. Comenta que le ha ido muy bien, tiene clientela fija, ya que no existe competencia por los alrededores. 
Su mercadería la compra en supermercados mayoristas y distribuidoras.
Con el crédito comprará mercadería y mandará a reparar una maquina refrigeradora que se encuentra en mal estado. 
Sus metas en su negocio son ampliar su negocio y abastecerlo de mercadería, para que éste le brinde mayores ganancias y seguir invirtiendo,  de ésta manera comprar un cooler y una máquina de helados.
Margarita vive junto a su marido y tres hijos de 29, 23 y 20 años de edad, además de un nieto de 5 años de edad. 
Sus sueños son prosperar en su negocio, para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, además se siente muy cómoda con el grupo del Banco comunal, ya que se ha afiatado, ha conocido más gente y le ha permitido también distraerse de sus labores cotidianas. Respecto a las capacitaciones realizadas en las reuniones del grupo del Banco comunal, ha podido aprender a administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
Villa Alemana es una comuna ubicada en la provincia de Marga Marga, región de Valparaíso, zona central de Chile. Es conocida como la "ciudad de los molinos", por la gran cantidad de casas quinta que necesitaban sacar agua a través de molinos. 
También se la conoce como la “Ciudad de la Eterna Juventud”, por su clima templado, muy benigno, que la caracteriza de la siguiente manera "por su clima, la juventud no teme a la vejez. La vejez en Villa Alemana vive en eterna juventud". 
El nombre “Villa Alemana” se debe a que  fueron inmigrantes alemanes los primeros en comprar sitios e instalarse en este territorio.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member and serves as treasurer of the communal bank “Fondo Amigo” in the town of Villa Alemana. She has been working in the commerce sector for 9 years, working and making sales in her home based business. She offers vegetables and groceries and handicraft items of wooden decoupage which she creates.

Her schedule is from 8:00AM until 9:00PM in the evening, every day of the week. Her husband helps her take care of the business. She says that she has done very well, she has regular clients, and there is no nearby competition. She buys her merchandise in supermarkets and from wholesale distributors.

With this loan she will buy some merchandise and have a refrigerator fixed that is not working. Her goal is to expand her business and stock her store with merchandise so that she can earn more income and continue investing and in this way to buy a cooler and an ice cream machine.

Margarita lives together with her husband and three children of 29, 23, and 20 years of age, and with a grandson who is 5 years old. Her dream is to prosper in her business, in order to provide her family with a better quality of life. She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity offered by Fondo Esperanza. She feels very comfortable with the communal bank group. It is a solid group, and she has met new people and has found it a welcome change to her daily activity. She has learned from the meetings at the communal bank how to manage her business better.

Villa Alemana is a township located in the province of Marga Marga, a region of Valparaiso, in the central part of Chile. It is known as the City of Mills because there are so many large country homes with watermills. It is also known as the City of Eternal Youth for its temperate climate, which is mild and there is a saying that "through its climate, the youth have no fear of old age. Eternal old age lives in Villa Alemana youth."  

The name Villa Alemana came about because German immigrants were the first to buy land sites and start building in this area.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and to have a refrigerator repaired

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Don Juan tiene 33 años de edad, vive con su mamá de 68 años, su compañera de vida y con un hijo.

Él se dedica desde los 12 años a la agricultura y a cuidar ganado junto con su hermano mayor. Fue su papá quien les enseñó este trabajo para que ellos tuvieran como ganarse la vida honradamente.

Don Juan tiene que trasladarse a una ciudad del oriente del país, para adquirir los insumos necesarios para realizar su trabajo. Don Juan se levanta todos los días a las 5:00 de la mañana a pastorear los animales y luego se dedica a las labores en su cultivo de maíz.

Él solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo para comprar dos vacas de ordeño (que den leche) y cultivar maíz. De esta forma Don Juan podrá vender la leche que den estas vacas todos los días en su comunidad, y con este ingreso podrá llevarle alimento a su familia y comprar insumos agrícolas. Don Juan es el único proveedor para su familia.

Don Juan vive con su mamá, su esposa y su hijo en una casa de 4x5 metros cuadrados de adobe, con techo de láminas de metal muy viejas  y no tiene habitaciones. El sueño de Don Juan es construir una casa de ladrillo con habitaciones. Con las ganancias que obtenga de su trabajo él quiere ahorrar para hacer realidad su sueño.
texts.en:
Juan is 33 years old, lives with his 68 year old mother, his life partner and a child. 

He has been working in agriculture and livestock care for 12 years together with his older brother. It was his father who taught them this work in order that they could earn an honest living.

Juan has to travel to a city in the eastern part of the country in order to get the supplies he needs so he can do his work. Juan gets up every day at 5:00AM to graze the animals and later he works cultivating corn.

He is asking for a loan from Fundacion Campo in order to buy two dairy cows to obtain milk, and to grow corn. In this way Juan could sell the milk from the cows every day in his community and with this income could provide food to his family and buy agricultural supplies. Juan is the only provider for his family.

Juan lives with his mother, his life partner, and his child in a 4 x 5 square meter, very old, one-room adobe house, with a sheet metal roof. His dream is to build a brick house with rooms. He wants to save for his dream from the profits that he earns.

loans.use: to purchase two dairy cows and supplies to grow corn.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La señora Elsa es socia D. banco comunal San Fernando II, D. Distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y tiene seis hijos.
Son cuatro años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, se dedica a la venta de verduras de estación.
Con su nuevo préstamo  de S/. 1,700.00 nuevos soles  comprará: 2 sacos de choclos,  2 bandejas de plásticos, 2 paquetes de bolsas, 2 metros de plásticos.
Estos días está comprando choclos en mazorcas y lo está vendiendo desgranado para hacer humitas (dulce peruano), este negocio lo realiza hasta el mediodía, por las tardes sale a comprar las verduras para el siguiente día, ella se ubica en un mercado de la zona.
Su esposo también trabaja en forma independiente, todavía tiene en su casa a sus tres hijos solteros, pero que ya no dependen de ellos, todos trabajan, espera seguir trabajando con los prestamos de Manuela Ramos y así mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Elsa is a member of the communal bank San Fernando II, in the district of Calleria, department of Vcayali. She is 56 yeras old, married and has 6 children.

She has been a member of the communal bank Manuela Ramos for 4 years. She sells seasonal vegetables. With this new loan of 1700 soles she will buy: 2 bags of corn, 2 plastic trays, 2 packages of bags, and 2 meters of plastic.

These days she buys corn on the cob and she removes the husks in order to make humitas (humitas are smaller than tamales and are made with sweet ingredients instead of meat and are wrapped in corn husks.)

She takes care of this business until noon, and she spends the afternoon buying vegetables for the next day in a market place.

Her husband is also an independent worker. She has three single adult age children living with her who no longer depend on her. They all work. She is looking forward to obtaining a loan from Manuela Ramos and increasing her earnings.

loans.use: to purchase 2 bags of corn, 2 plastic trays, and other items

loans.name: Sergei

texts.ru:
Сергей – женат, у него двое взрослых детей. Сергей держит свой магазин бытовой химии в городе Мелитополе. У него в магазинчике всегда можно найти самый разнообразный ассортимент мыломоющих средств по сходной цене, что неизменно привлекает все новых покупателей. Сергей начал свое дело еще 17 лет назад. С тех пор его бизнес значительно вырос и ему даже удалось приобрести собственный магазин. 

Сергей планирует использовать кредит в 20 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить дополнительное количество средств бытовой химии, а именно зубных паст, стиральных порошков, мыла, гелей для мытья посуды, чистящих средств и т.п. для последующей реализации в своем магазине. Вместе с женой, которая активно помогает Сергею в бизнесе, торгуя на центральном городском рынке, они планируют и в дальнейшем развивать свое дело и получать стабильный доход для содержания своей семьи. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Sergei is married and has two grown children.  He has a household products store in the town of Melitopol.  One can always find a varied assortment of cleaning supplies at affordable prices at his store, which continues to attract new customers.  Sergei started his business 17 years ago.  Since then, his business grew significantly, and he was even able to purchase his own store.  Sergei plans to use the 20 000 hryvnia loan to buy an additional inventory of household cleaning supplies, especially toothpaste, laundry detergent, soap, dish washing liquid, cleaning supplies and such, for a subsequent sale at his store.  Together with his wife, who actively helps Sergei in this business, and selling at the central city market, they plan to further develop their business and earn a stable income to support their family.

loans.use: to buy an additional inventory of household cleaning supplies, especially toothpaste, laundry detergent, soap, dish washing liquid, cleaning supplies and such

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
La señora Dora es socia del banco comunal San Fernando II del Distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos.
Ella se dedica a brindar servicios de  comunicaciones, tiene un locutorio en su propia casa, que le da muchas facilidades de poder atender su casa y lo bueno es que no tiene que invertir en alquiler de local.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 soles, comprará: 4 bancas de madera, 2 teléfonos nuevos,  saldo para sus teléfonos, 25 tarjetas de diferentes precios.
Su esposo es docente universitario (profesor), el negocio en su casa es una gran ayuda para poder cubrir otros gastos, tiene que solventar los gastos de sus tres hijos.
Agradecen a Manuela Ramos por haberle aceptado integrar uno de sus bancos comunales y poder trabajar para el beneficio de toda su familia, de esta manera podrá apoyar a sus hijos hasta que terminen la carrera.
texts.en:
Dora is a member of the communal bank San Fernando II in the Calleria district, in the department of Ucayali, She is 50 years old, married and has 3 children. She works in communication services. She has a call center shop in her own home providing many communication services, and the good thing is she does not have to pay rent for her business location. With this new loan she will buy 4 wooden benches, 2 new telephones, account balances for the phones, and 25 prepaid cards offering different prices.

Her husband is a university professor. Her at-home business is a great help in order to cover other expenses. She has to pay the cost of living for her three children. She is grateful to the communal bank Manuela Ramos for working with her and to be able to work in order to provide for her family so that she can support the children until they finish their education.

loans.use: to purchase telephones and prepaid phone cards

loans.name: Gennadyi

texts.ru:
Геннадий женат, у него двое детей. Он живет и работает в городе Мелитополе. Геннадий торгует игрушками, очками, а также подростковой одеждой. Так как Мелитополь – городок небольшой, чаще всего предприниматели на рынке предоставляют на розничную продажу сразу несколько видов товаров и Геннадий не стал исключением. Кроме того, что Геннадий реализует свой товар на одном из местных рынков, он еще занимается выездной торговлей по близлежащим селам и поселкам. 

Геннадий занимается этим бизнесом уже на протяжении 16 лет. У него хороший опыт работы  и много постоянных покупателей. В товаре у него 45 000 гривен. На данный момент Геннадию необходим кредит в размере 20 000 гривен для того, чтобы увеличить ассортимент подростковой одежды, которую он реализует. В будущем Геннадий планирует и дальше расширять свой бизнес и заниматься этим видом товара, который всегда остается в постоянном спросе. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Gennadyi is married and has two children.  He lives and works in the town of Melitopol.  Gennadyi sells toys, glasses and also juniors clothing.  Because Melitopol is a small town, entrepreneurs at the market often offer various types of merchandise for retail sale, and Gennadyi is not an exception.  Besides the fact that Gennadyi sells his merchandise at one of the local markets, he is also involved in traveling sales at nearby villages.  Gennadyi has been involved in this business for 16 years.  He has a good work experience and many loyal customers.  His merchandise is valued at 45 000 hryvnia.  Currently, Gennadyi needs a loan in the sum of 20 000 hryvnia in order to expand his assortment of juniors clothing that he sells. In the future, Gennadyi plans to further expand his business and always sell merchandise that is in high demand.

loans.use: to expand an assortment of juniors clothing, which he sells

loans.name: Julia Maria

texts.es:
La señora Julia es socia del banco comunal San Fernando II del Distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y tiene siete hijos.
Son ocho años que viene trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos y  acondicionó un ambiente especial en su casa  para instalar su bodega, más adelante desea tener un multiservicio.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 comprará: 2 paquetes de harina, 2 paquetes de fideos, 1 caja de leche chica, 1 caja de leche grande, ½ caja de conservas, 1 caja de pasta dental, 1 caja de jaboncillo, 1 caja de aceite, 5 casilleros de huevo, 1 saco de azúcar.
Ya cuenta con las vitrinas adecuadas para exhibir sus productos, su hija atiende en la bodega mientras está ocupada haciendo sus quehaceres del hogar, su esposo es trabajador independiente, está muy contento porque su esposa también lo apoya económicamente.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the San Fernando II del Distrito Calleria community bank located in the department of Ucayali.  She is 55 years old, married, and has seven children.  She began working with loans from Manuela Ramos eight years ago, and renovated a special area in her home to open her store.  In the future, she wants to have a multi-service store. 

With her new loan of $3000 she will purchase two packages of flour, two packages of pasta, one box of milk in small containers, one box of milk in large containers, half a box of canned food, one box of toothpaste, one box of soap, one box of oil, five boxes of eggs, and one sack of sugar.

She already has enough display cases to show her products.  Her daughter tends the store while Julia does her housework.  Her husband is an independent worker.  He is very happy that his wife helps support them financially.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, flour, soaps, and eggs.

loans.name: Maria Orfilia

texts.es:
