She is 64 years old and is single with six children. She works running her small general store. She also makes chicha blanca, a traditional corn-based drink, and sells it in the corner of her store. She works from six in the morning until ten in the evening. She sells her chicha blanca from mid-morning through the afternoon. She will use the loan to purchase rice, sugar, flour, milk, noodles, and other products for her store.

She is grateful for the support offered and pledges to be disciplined in making her payments.

loans.use: purchase staple products like rice, boxed milk, sugar, flour, and noodles for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes in order to sell them.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES UNIDAS”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de San Jeronimo en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Francisca, la socia tiene 41 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 4 hijos, la socia se dedica  a la atención de su panificadora, la socia tiene una panificadora y ella está encargada de abrir el horno, poner leñas, y verificar la maza y salida de los panes en general ella se encarga de ver todo el proceso de la elaboración de los panes, la socia desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de levadura, harina, moldes para la realización de los panes, la socia a diario saca 200 panes de cada tipo, ella tiene el apoyo de sus esposo en cuanto a la atención de la panadería, la socia en esta ocasión solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de harina, levadura para la elaboración de los panes.
La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "Mujeres Unidas" (United Women) Community Bank located in the San Jeronimo district in the province and department of Cuzco.

Her name is Francisca and she is 41 years old, married, and has four children. She has a bakery and is in charge of opening the oven, putting in firewood, checking the dough, and removing the bread. She is basically in charge of the whole bread-making process. She wants a loan to invest in yeast, flour, and bread pans. Every day she makes 200 breads of all different kinds. She has the support of her husband when it comes to working in the bakery.

She is thankful for the support you will provide her and promises to be disciplined with making the payments.

loans.use: buy  flour and yeast to make bread

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is married with 8 children. She is 57 years old and lives in the ZNAC, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.
Clarita has a rubber farm. She has requested a loan of 7000 to pay for her daughter's college tuition fees.
Clarita has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Clarita hopes to expand her rubber farm to plant other rubber seedlings.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's college tuition fees

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is married with 6 children. She is 48 years old and lives in Dansalan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.
Caroline sells medicines such as herbal capsules and herbal oil. She has had this business for 15 years. Each month she earns 10000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 7000 to purchase  6 boxes of herbal capsule and 4 litres of herbal oil to sell.
Caroline has been a member of PMPC for more than 1 year. In the future, Caroline hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase 6 boxes of herbal capsules and 4 litres of herbal oil to sell

loans.name: Melvie

texts.en:
Melvie is married with 1 child. She is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines.
Melvie is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. She has requested a loan of 30,000 to purchase fertilizer for the rice. 
Melvie has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Melvie hopes to save money for the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for rice

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
Wilfredo is 61 years old and lives in Centro Napu, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. He is widowed with 5 children. 
Wilfredo sells fish for a living. He has been doing this for 30 years. He has requested a loan of 12,000 to  purchase fishing materials such as hooks and nets.
Wilfredo has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, Wilfredo hopes to save money for his old age.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials such as hooks and nets

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is married with 3 children. She is 66 years old and lives in Upper Centro, Tudela, Misamis Occidental
Clarita sells items such as canned goods, noodles and biscuits. She has had this business for 1 year. Each month she earns PHP 7,000.00. She has requested a loan of 50,000.00 to  purchase additional products for the grocery store.
Clarita has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Clarita hopes to save money for her old age.

loans.use: to purchase additional products for the grocery store

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo is married with 4 children. He is 52 years old and lives in Romarate, Aurora Zamboanga del Sur.

Ricardo is enjoying his banana farm. This is the primary source of income for his family. His wife sells snacks as an additional source of revenue. Every cropping he sells bananas to his contract buyer. He has been in this business for 3 years. Ricardo earns net PHP 4000 doing this kind of work. 

He is asking for a loan of PHP 7000 to buy seedlings and fertilizer for banana production. Ricardo has been a member of GDMPC for 4 years. He wants to purchase land to produce more bananas.


GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

GDMPC people empowering people.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Wilhelmina

texts.en:
Wilhelmina is single with no children. She is 68 years old and lives in the Philippines.
Wilhelmina is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. She has requested a loan of 50,000 to purchase fertilizer for the rice . 
Wilhelmina has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Wilhelmina hopes to save money for her old age.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for rice

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 
Venus has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stock for her shop .
Venus is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Venus hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Buenaventurada

texts.en:
Buenaventurada is 41 years old and lives in Lupagan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 2 children. 
Buenaventurada has a motorcycle transport business and earns approximately PHP 6,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of 3,000 to repair her motorcycle . 
Buenaventurada has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Buenaventurada hopes to send her children to college.

loans.use: to repair her motorcycle

loans.name: Shirlita

texts.en:
Shirlita is widowed with 2 children. She is 30 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin, Misamis Occidental.
Shirlita sells grocery goods to earn a living and has had this business for 4 years. Each month, she earns PHP 10,000. She has requested a loan of 14,900 to purchase additional groceries.
Shirlita has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Shirlita hope to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods

loans.name: Merissa

texts.en:
Merissa is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child.
 
Merissa has a retail shop that sells used clothing or ukay-ukay like bed sheets. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of used clothing or ukay-ukay to sell.

Merissa is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Merissa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of ukay-ukay (second hand clothing) to sell

loans.name: Norma Group

texts.en:
Norma is married with 5 children. She is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Norma is a farmer and raises pigs to sell to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. She has requested a loan of 14,900 to purchase pigs to raise. Norma has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Norma hopes to save money for her old age.

Norma is the leader of a 2 person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase pigs to raise

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is married with 6 children. She is 43 years old.

Elvira owns a sari-sari (variety) store to earn a living and has had this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns 1000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 3000 to purchase stock for her general store.

Elvira has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Elvira hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her general store

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 9 children. 

Dolores owns a videoke or karaoke shop that provides a karaoke machine that customers pay 5 pesos per song to use. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy tools and pay for the electricity for maintenance.

Dolores is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Dolores hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the electricity for maintenance of her karaoke machine

loans.name: Cuneta

texts.en:
Cuneta is 44 years old and lives in Palomoc, Titay, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married.

Cuneta has a retail business and earns approximately 5000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5000 to purchase cases of coke, groceries and sacks of charcoal to sell.

Cuneta became a member of PMPC this year (2011). In the future, Cuneta hopes to expand her store.

loans.use: to purchase cases of coke, groceries and sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.en:
Basilisa is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 10 children.

Basilisa has a retail shop that sells coconut and wood charcoal by the sack. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy coconut shells and wood for charcoal making.

Basilisa is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Basilisa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconut shells and wood for charcoal making

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 9 children.

Lourdes has a retail shop that makes and sells baskets. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of  5,000 PHP to buy raw materials needed for basket weaving.

Lourdes is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Lourdes hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials needed for basket weaving

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 3 children.

Merlyn has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of  5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Merlyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Merlyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Melagrosa

texts.en:
Melagrosa is widowed with 4 children. Melagrosa is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Melagrosa is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for 30 years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer for the rice.

Melagrosa has been a member of PMPC for one year. Melagrosa hopes to save money for the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for the rice

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children.

Marietta has a retail shop that sells generic drugs like paracetamol and ambroxol. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of generic drugs to sell.

Marietta is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Marietta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of generic drugs to sell

loans.name: Khlok's Group

texts.en:
This 5-member group of people, led by Klork, resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area with a variety of businesses including agriculture, livestock-breeding, and fisH..

Klork is a 46-year-old married woman who lives with her common-law husband with whom she has six children, one of whom is already married and living separately. The other five are single, living with her, and attending high school and primary school. A very hard-working woman involved in the fisH. business, she can earn enough income to cover her family’s expenses.

Klork is now requesting her first loan with Kiva partner HKL in the amount of $100USD to buy fisH. materials. She and her family hope that it will contribute to her family's financial well-being, and they are very grateful to all of Kiva's lenders for their support. Klork’s dreams are to have a large house and enable all of her children to at least finish high school.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials.

loans.name: Bernie

texts.en:
Bernie is married with 5 children.  She is 32 years old and lives in Lopoc, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.
To earn a living, Bernie has a piggery that she has been managing for 6 years. She has requested a loan of 3000 to purchase pigs.
Bernie is a new member of PMPC, joining this year (2011). In the future, Bernie hopes to expand her garden to plant other crops.

loans.use: to purchase pigs

loans.name: Joylyn

texts.en:
Joylyn is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Joylyn has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages for sale at her store.
Joylyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Joylyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages for her store.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. 
Concepcion has a retail shop that sells silver & gold plated necklaces, bracelets and other jewelry.  She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy additional stock of silver & gold jewelry.
Concepcion is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Concepcion hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of silver & gold jewelry for her shop.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
Benedicta is 58 years old and lives in Camanse, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental . She is married with 3 children. 
Benedicta has a shop that sells canned goods, soap, toothpaste and other retail items. She has been running this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional inventory for her store.
Benedicta has been a member of PMPC for 3 years and hopes to save money for future use.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her general store

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 3 children. 
Julius provides motorcycle or habal-habal services.  He has been providing these services for 6 years.  He has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools & to pay for the gasoline and maintenance of his motorcycle.
Julius is a new member of HSPFI and hopes to improve his business in future.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline and maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 
Mercedes has a retail shop that sells coconut charcoal by the sacks. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy coconut shells for charcoal making.
Mercedes is a new member of HSPFI and hopes to improve her business in future.

loans.use: to buy coconut shells for charcoal making

loans.name: Ri's Group

texts.en:
This is a loan group with four members that is located in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Ri was chosen as the team leader. She is 57 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their five children. All of her children are single and she is supporting them. They are attending primary and high school. Siem Reap province is an area with many kinds of businesses such as agriculture, livestock breeding, and fisheries. Currently, Ri is engaged in trading fish and she has been involved in this industry for many years. Ri earns enough income to cover her family’s expenses. She is a very hardworking woM. woM. who does different things to provide for her family. 

Ri is requesting a 100 USD loan to buy fish to sell and improve her family's living conditions. This will be the first cycle of this loan and her second cycle with the Kiva partner HKL. Ri and her family hope that her loan will help her family find happiness and prosperity and earn more profit. Ri is very grateful to all the kind donors who help her family. Her dreams are to have a larger house and educate all of her children at least through high school.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is married with 5 children.  She is 54 years old and lives in Lumbayao, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.
To earn a living, Wilma has been managing a piggery for 2 years. She has requested a loan of 5000 to purchase pigs.
Wilma has been a member of PMPC for 2 years and hopes to expand her business in future.

loans.use: to purchase pigs

loans.name: Conchita's Group

texts.en:
Conchita is married with one child.  She is 65 years old and lives in Tabid, Ozamis City.  Conchita operates a general store to earn a living, and has had this business for 3 years.  Each month, she earns PHP 4000 from running the store.  She has requested a loan for 14990 to buy grocery items like canned goods and other items for her store.
Conchita has been a member of PMPC for 2 years and hopes to save money for the future.
Conchita is the leader of a 2 person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items like canned goods for her store.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 45 years old and lives in Tinago, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental.  She is married with 2 adult and 4 school age children.  Lolita has a shop that sells canned goods, soap, toothpaste, noodles and other retail items.  She has had this business for almost 2 years. 

Lolita has requested a loan of 14,900 to purchase additional inventory such as canned goods, soap, toothpaste, noodles and etc. Lolita has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Lolita hopes to see her children finish college.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory such as canned goods, soap, toothpaste, noodles etc. for her store.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 1 child. 

John provides motorela or habal-habal services.   He has had this business for 5 years.  He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools & pay for the gasoline and maintenance of his vehicle.  John is a new member of HSPFI and hopes to improve his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for gasoline and maintenance.

loans.name: Razel

texts.en:
Razel, a 30-year-old single mom with one child, lives in Cabgan, Tambulig Zamboanga del Sur, far from town and accessible only by boat. For the past six years, she has owned and managed a sari-sari store to earn a living, making about PHP 9500 each month.

A member of GDMPC for three years, Razel is requesting a loan of PHP 25000 to purchase goods for her store. She hopes to expand her business in the future and build a house.

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. GDMPC: people empowering people.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en: Hilda, a 36-year-old married mother of one, lives in the Philippines where she has had a retail shop that buys and sells coconut lumber for the past six years. A new member of HSPFI, she is requesting a  a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of coco lumber in various sizes. In the future, Hilda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of coco lumber in various sizes.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga, 51, a resident of GMA Cavite, Philippines, is married to Luis, her business-partner, and the mother of four children, one of whom already has his own family; another works in a factory, while two remain at home helping their parents in their business. Together with her husband and children, Dominga manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Dominga operates a salted-egg production business. She buys raw materials and supplies used in salted egg production such as duck eggs, and processes them into red-salted eggs, earning a small margin for every salted egg sold by her husband and their two dealers. Her finished products are distributed to markets, nearby communities and other places where she has contacts for her products. She earns a minimum of 546 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales each day.

To help her continue business operations, Dominga is requesting a Php19,000 loan to buy raw materials and supplies needed in salted-egg production. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Dominga dreams of being able to give all her children a good future and hopes to support her family through her hard work in her business. She also aspires to draw more customers in the future. Every week she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children. 

Rita has a retail shop that sells clothing like blouses, t-shirts, underwear and shorts. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy shirts, blouses, underwear and shorts for resale.

Rita is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Rita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses, underwear and shorts to resell.

loans.name: Selita

texts.en:
Selita is 33 years old and has a hog-fattening business. She's in this business to save for the future of her three children and to provide for their needs.

This causes her to asks a loan amount of PHP 6,000 to buy two more hogs and feed. 

She felt so happy to know about Alalay sa Kaunlaran (ASKI) Inc. because this organization let her borrow for the improvement of her business as well as their poor living. She hopes to uplift her family from poverty through her hard work and courage to confront financial problems.

loans.use: to buy two more hogs and feed.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Rice and corn production are the primary source of income at Annayatan, Baggao, Cagayan. Vilma lives in this village together with her spouse and two children. The couple inherited a two-hectare plot of land from their in-laws and have been cultivating it for almost 15 years. 

Last crop season, they earned a yield of 35,000 PHP. Due to the expensive cost of farm inputs and daily needs at home, the profits earned were just enough to cover daily meals and the education expenses of her two children.

With her desire to improve her crop production, she is now asking for a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides, and also to pay for laborers who help in transplanting rice seedlings in her rice field.

In the future, Vilma would like to achieve a plentiful harvest every harvest season. She also wants to continuously educate her children so that they can achieve degrees and pursue their chosen careers for the improvement of their lives someday.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides, and pay for laborers who help in transplanting rice seedlings.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 46 years old and married to a fisherman. For almost a month she has been selling fish in their community. She doesn’t feel tiredness in selling every day but she feels more exhausted when she sees her only child suffering from the poor living that they have.

So, she is working hard to provide a more comfortable life for her family. She wants to improve her business, and that’s why she is asking a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy fishes and a styrofoam crate to stock her fishes. She hopes this will provide a higher income and lift their poor living from the current hardship. She hopes especially that she can satisfy the needs of her child.

loans.use: to buy fishes and even one Styrofoam where she stocks her fishes

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 31 years old. She has been a fish vendor in her community for almost a month. This occupation provides financial benefits to her family. So she is patiently walking while carrying her styrofoam and weighing scale to sell daily. 

She was blessed with five children and three of them are studying. She needs to sell every day to give them allowances for school. 

She is earning PHP 200 daily, which is insufficient. Due to this low income, she is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy additional fishes to sell. She hopes to increase her income to improve their unprivileged lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy additional fishes to sell.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children.
 
Leonora buys and peddles home products like umbrellas, watches, radios and other items. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stock to sell like umbrellas, watches, radios etc.

Leonora is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Leonora hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell like umbrellas, watches, radios, etc

loans.name: Jellyzle

texts.en:
Jellyzle is 24 years old and a motorcycle operator. She is married to a farmer and blessed with two children. Because of their unprivileged living, she operates their motorcycle instead of staying at home. They are helping each other to improve their living. Even though it is difficult to be a motorcycle operator and a mother, she remains strong for the sake of her children. She is enduring difficulties in earning money yet she is very inspired because of them. 

Operating a motorcycle every day may leads to its deterioration, so it needs maintenance. So Jellyzle is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy new tires as well as perform maintenance. She hopes these repairs will keep the motorcycle strong in order to earn a higher income for the betterment of their living.

loans.use: to buy new tires and provide motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Ruthchel

texts.en:
Ruthchel is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.
 
Ruthchel buys and sells t-shirts, blouses and underwear. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy clothing like t-shirts and blouses for resale.

Ruthchel is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Ruthchel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing like t-shirts and blouses to sell.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 60 years old and lives in Ciriaco Pastrano, Oroquieta City. She is married and has six children.
 
To earn a living, Norma has a business selling items such as rice, cigarettes, milk, sugar, soft drinks and canned goods. She earns about PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. 

Norma has a requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase stocks for her general store. Norma has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Norma would like to have more capital and own a general store.

loans.use: to purchase stocks for her general store.

loans.name: Jeneth

texts.en:
Jeneth is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.
 
Jeneth has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Jeneth is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Jeneth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Emelinda

texts.en: Emelinda is 51 years old and blessed with six children. She wants her children to pursue an education so they can become professionals. But because of life's difficulties, four of her children are already married and unable to continue their education. Despite that, she remains strong and engaged in her hog-fattening business in order to provide for every need of her remaining children who are studying. Her hogs usually lack food and for this reason Emelinda is asking for a loan of P6,000 to buy enough feed and vitamins to provide them with better nourishment. She hopes this will increaser her income and help her to provide better living conditions for her family. She wants to have a comfortable life and doesn’t want her children to experience the same difficulties she has faced.

loans.use: to buy enough feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Avil

texts.en: Avil is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 10 children. Avil has a retail shop that sells coconut wine and charcoal by the sack. She has had this business for 10 years. Avil requested a loan for PHP 3,000 to buy coconut shells and wood for making charcoal. Avil is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Avil hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconut shells and wood to make charcoal.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en: Emelyn is 34 years old and has been selling vegetables for two years. From her income she is able to send her three children to school and earn enough for the school and other every day expenses. Emelyn walks everyday, rain or shine, to sell her produce. Her business requires a lot of patience because it is a difficult to go to the market and sell, especially during the poor season. Sometimes Emelyn travels to other communities to sell. Emelyn requested a loan of P6,000 to buy eggplants, okra, cabbage and pechay as additional goods to sell. She is working hard to earn a higher income so she can save to buy a motorcycle service someday. This would allow her to travel comfortably and easily to sell her produce daily.

loans.use: to buy eggplants, okra, cabbage and pechay as additional goods to sell.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with four children. Carlos has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and viands like halang-halang. He has had this business for 20 years. He requested a loan for 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and viands to sell.

Carlos has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Carlos hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and viands to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 56 years old and lives in Tubod Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married, with 9 children. 
To earn a living, Elizabeth has a business selling food, such as hotcakes, puto, bibingka, soman, etc.  She earns about PHP 600 each month doing this type of work. Elizabeth has requested a loan of 6,000 to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending.
Elizabeth has been a member of PMPC for 4 months.  In the future, Elizabeth would like to have a food stall near in her house.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila is 30 years old and wishes to provide for the needs and demands of her three children. But because of poverty, she has had trouble providing for their everyday needs. She felt guilty and that led her to work harder. She is currently engaged in the hog fattening business where she can take care of their everyday expenses.

She wants to further improve her business so she is asking for a loan of P6,000 to buy feeds and a hog.  She hopes this will provide a better income in and also allow her children to concentrate to their studies.

loans.use: to buy feeds and hog

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with one child.  Mylene has a retail shop that sells souvenirs, like bracelets, key chains & carved wood with designs & prints. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stock of souvenirs to sell.  Mylene is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Mylene hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of souvenirs to sell

loans.name: Ednalyn

texts.en:
Ednalyn is 45 years old and has two children who attend school.  She is engaged in selling vegetables, candies, and biscuits in the school canteen. She also cooks vegetables and sells them to the students. Through this business, she can afford to send her children to school.  

Because she wants to improve her business, Ednalyn is requesting a loan for 20,000 PHP to buy soft drinks, breads, hot dogs, and Styrofoam boxes. She wants to earn an increased income for the continuous education of her children. She hopes that they will someday hold a degree.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, breads, hot dogs, and Styrofoam boxes

loans.name: Marve

texts.en: Marve is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Marve has a retail shop that sells souvenir shirts, pajamas and bath towels. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy t-shirts needed for making souvenir shirts. Marve is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Marve hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts needed for making souvenir shirts

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en: Raquel is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Raquel has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Raquel is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Raquel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Rodith

texts.en:
Rodith is married with 4 children. She is 32 years old and lives in Cabgan, Tambulig Zamboanga del Sur.

To earn a living, Rodith buys crabs from her constituents and sells them to her buyer in the market. She has another line of business selling gasoline for pump boats. People in Cabgan use pump boats for their transportation. They live on an island, surrounded by water. Rodith has been engaged in this business for 10 years. She has a net income of 8,000 PHP per month. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase more crabs and gasoline to sell. Rodith has been a member of GDMPC for 3 years. 

In the future, Rodith hopes to have her own food stall in the market so she can display her products.

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

GDMPC people empowering people.

loans.use: to purchase crabs and gasoline to sell

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina is 38 years old and married to a farmer. She just finished elementary schooling. Her education suffers because of the poor living of her parents. She doesn’t want to impart this fate to her three children, so she needs to work in order to provide for their needs. For almost a month, she has engaged herself in raising pigs. It is difficult at first because the fact is, she is still grasping this occupation.

The desire to lift their living condition into better, leads her to ask for a loan amount of 5,000 PHP to buy feed and pigs to raise. She said that, though it is difficult to care for several pigs, it leads to higher income soon. Felomina is patiently caring for pigs to provide a better future for her children.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en: Avelina is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. Avelina has a food shop that sells candies, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy snacks, candies and beverages to sell. Avelina is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Avelina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, candies and beverages to sell

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 33 years old and lives in Ibabao, Aloran, Misamis, Occidental. She is married and has 4 children. 

Nilda has a sari-sari store business and earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of PHP10,000 to purchase more stock for her general store. 

Nilda has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, Nilda hopes to have a grocery store. Nilda is a MIGS member of PMPC. She is a good mother and a loving wife.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 54 years old. She is engaged in selling vegetables and kakanin (native sweet delicacies). She earns money to cover the every day expenses for the education of her four children. She is thankful that her children can help her in preparing the goods, especially on non-school days. Most of the time she lacks enough funds to provide an allowance for her children. 

For this reason, she is asking for a loan amount of PHP6,000 from Alalay Sa Kaunlaran (ASKI) Inc. to buy beans, eggplants, cabbage, sugar and milk to make kakanin and sell to their village. This will be a big help in expanding and upgrading her income.Through this, she can provide enough allowance to her children. She hopes it will also be a factor in uplifting their poor standard of living.

loans.use: to buy beans, eggplant, cabbage, sugar and milk to make kakanin.

loans.name: Mandiri 2 Group

texts.en:
Rini is 33 years old and married with two children. She is pictured on the far left of the photo. She has been selling clothes from her house and going door to door for the past five years. She is using the loan to increase her inventory and hopefully expand her business to generate enough income to someday open a clothing store in front of her house. 

As her education was only through high school, it is important to her that her children stay in school, and her income helps pay for school fees. She hopes that this loan will improve the well-being of her family. 

Some of the other group members will use their loans for selling snacks and a special Indonesian rice dish (nasi uduk).

loans.use: to pay for more clothes to resell to customers on credit

loans.name: Felicisima

texts.en:
Felicisima is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed. 

Felicisima has a retail shop where she sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Felicisima is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Felicisima hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is in her fifties. She has been widowed for almost six years and she is blessed with eight children. Six of them were married early and the other two are still single and working. She is thankful because she has been able to raise her children since her husband had left them.

Teresita runs her home-based store for almost nine years and she is able to earn about PHP3,000 a month. According to her, the income she generates from her business is great. This is true, most especially, in the months of crop seasons during April-May for the first crop and September-November for the second crop. 

Aside from groceries, Teresita is also vending some vegetables and meats because their location is far from the market. For these reason, she wants to offer products for all of the needs of her neighborhood. But, due to shortage of funds she has, she is asking for additional capital funds of PHP20,000 to buy stock of groceries, vegetables and meat. Through this amount, she can further support her family's needs.

Teresita is looking forward to making her business grow, which will enable her to become a successful entrepreneur someday.

loans.use: to buy stock groceries such as soft drinks, canned goods, ingredients, shampoo, junkfood, biscuits, meat and vegetable needed in her retailing business.

loans.name: Andrie

texts.en:
Andrie is 20 years old and lives in San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City. He is single. 

To earn a living, Andrie has a business selling items such as cigarettes, vegetable oil, salt, noodles, milk, canned goods,etc. He earns about PHP 1000 each month doing this type of work. Andrie has a requested a loan of PHP7,000 to purchase ingredients for his snacks business. Andrie has been a member of PMPC for 3 months. In the future, Andrie would like to owned a mini mart.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for his snacks business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Erlinda has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages . She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Erlinda is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Erlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Delma

texts.en:
Delma is a high school graduate and never entered college due to her parents being poor. Right now, she is 44 years old and operating her sari-sari (variety) store. She was already married and blessed with five children. Though she suffers difficulty in sending them all to school, she still pursues working hard for the sake of their education.

She wants to save for her children, so she is asking for additional working capital amounting to 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy pepper, Vetsin (monosodium glutamate), salt, breads and soft drinks. She hopes that through this, she could earn higher profits to save. This might be a way to provide for the needs of her children in school. By then, they could finish their education and achieve their dreams. She hopes they will then help uplift their existing living conditions.

loans.use: to buy ingredients needed in cooking -- pepper, Vetsin (monosodium glutamate), salt -- and breads and soft drinks.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Marites has a vulcanizing shop that provides motor repairs with her husband as the main repairman. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy tools needed and to pay for the electricity for the services.

Marites is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Marites hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools needed and pay for the electricity for the services.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 45 years old and has been engaged in a piggery business for two years. Her family is not privileged, they barely eat three times a day. This has motivated her to ask for a loan of 6,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) from Alalay Sa Kaunlaran (ASKI) Inc. 

She plans to use it to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs to improve her piggery business and soon achieve a better income. It would also provide payment for other obligations. 

She is working hard to save and provide for the educational needs of her children. In fact, she also works in the field for an additional source of income: she plants and harvests crops in other people's fields. 

She hopes to overcome these difficulties and obtain a comfortable life in the future.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 47 years old and is married to a local farmer, they both live in Awallan, Baggao, Cagayan. They were not blessed with any children. Though the couple is less fortunate, they are still happy. Josephine still hopes that someday she will be able to lift her family out of poverty. 

She works very hard to provide for their daily expenses. To generate income, she operates a sari-sari (variety) store selling grocery items such as noodles, canned goods, breads, soap, and shampoo to the people in her village. She usually earns about 4,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) each month. She uses this income partly as revolving capital for the business, and partly for their daily expenses like meals. 

She wants to offer more grocery items, that is why she is now asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy eggs, sugar, milk, coffee and canned goods to sell in her store. This would help boost her profit. 

In the future, Josephine would like to become financially stable and save for future expenses, especially the couple's old age.

loans.use: to buy eggs, sugar, milk, coffee, and canned goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Hean's Group

texts.en:
This is a loan group with four members that is located in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Hean was chosen as the team leader. He is 31 years old and he lives with his common-law wife and their four children. All of his children are attending school. Since 2008, Hean has run a transportation business as a Tuk-tuk driver and he earns approximately 4 USD each day. He is working very hard and striving to earn something for himself and contribute to the household expenses. Hean works every day from six in the morning through six at night.

Hean is requesting a loan to repair and renovate his house. He hopes that this loan will help his family find happiness and prosperity and allow him to educate his children through university and honor his village. This will be the eighth cycle of his HKL loans and the third cycle of his Kiva partner loans. He is very thankful to all of the kind donors who always help his family.

loans.use: to repair his broken house

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. 

Marites has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. 

Marites is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Marites hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Mellie

texts.en:
Mellie is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. 

Mellie has a food shop, or carenderia, that sells viands like chicken & pork adobo, afritada & caldereta. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients for making viands. 

Mellie is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Mellie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making viands

loans.name: Mira

texts.en:
This is Mira, 45. She is a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Benjamin, a jeepney (transport) operator, and is a mother to her two children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating the business.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Mira operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5-pesos worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this, they have a jeep (public utility vehicle) that her husband manages. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,300 Philippines pesos (php) in sales every day. 
    
To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Mira hopes her business grows in the coming years and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Asylkan's Group

texts.en: Asylkan is the leader of this group. She is 56, and unfortunately, she is a widow. She has raised four children: two daughters work in a sewing workshop, the first son is in construction and the youngest son goes to school. Asylkan works as a bookkeeper in the police department. In order to earn additional money, she breeds cattle and resells it after fattening. With money received from the loan, Asylkan wants to purchase feed for her cattle. Some part of the loan she will use to purchase home furniture. In the future, she wishes to build a house for her sons. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her cattle.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Lydia has a retail shop that sells firewood. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional firewood to sell.

Lydia is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Lydia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional firewood to sell.

loans.name: Gongseng Indah 1 Group

texts.en:
Pertiwi is 34 years old and married with four children. She is wearing a green shirt in the photo. Two of her children are of school age and are currently enrolled. The other two are ages one and four. She has owned a general store for five years. She will use this loan to expand her inventory in her store by purchasing more rice, oil, eggs, etc. She hopes that the expanded inventory will increase the profitability, allowing her to have more income to hopefully pay for all of her children's tuition through college.

Some of the other group members will use their loans to sell snacks and clothing on credit.

loans.use: to pay for rice, oil, eggs, and other daily-use items  to increase shop inventory.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
At 38 years of age, Conchita is an business-minded and dedicated person to her business, a store where she sells all basic commodities and at the same time she sells some cosmetic products, shirts, sandals and bags as a source of additional income. She has had this business for nine years and she is happy because she has a lot of profit.The profit she generates from her business is used for their daily needs, the allowance of her eldest son, and payment for their electric bill.

Conchita enjoys her daily routine while her husband is also busy in cultivating their rice fields. She hopes to have more customers and gain greater income to have her store stocked with a great variety of items. Her goal is to improve her direct selling business so that she can have additional capital in maintaining her store.

Currently Conchita needs a loan amount of P20,000 to buy groceries to stock such as canned goods, oil, sugar, milk, junk foods, assorted biscuits and soft drinks  for her  home-based store.She hopes that she can obtain her requested loan amount. She believes that she could make her business grow and be profitable because of her hard work and patience in managing her store and direct selling business.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as canned goods, oil, sugar, milk, junk foods, assorted biscuits and soft drinks  for her  home-based store

loans.name: Juvelinda

texts.en:
Raising hogs to fatten and sell in the future is Juvelinda's business. She started it five years ago. She is married to a local framer named Edwin and was blessed with four children. She is engaged in a business to meet their daily needs and the allowances of her children. Three of them are attending school. The eldest was not able to enter college due to the financial burden to sustain her and she was then engaged in an early marriage. 

She wants to continuously provide a good education for the rest of her children, which is why she needs to make her business more profitable.

She is now asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy additional hogs to raise, hog feed and medicines to ensure proper growth and nutrition.

In the future, she wants her children to have a degree and good employment.

loans.use: to buy hogs, feed and medicines.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
This is Editha, 59, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Miguel, a jeepney operator, and mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Editha maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these profits are the dealer's income. Aside from this, they have two jeeps (public utility vehicle) that her husband manages. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 4,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 38,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise and pay for the orders from her customers. Part of the loan will be used to maintain their jeepney. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Editha dreams to be able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Kroch's Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan with four members that is located in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Mrs. Krouch was chosen to be a team leader. Presently, she has been generating a kind of business as a cake seller in one market near her village. According to her good relationship to all clients, it is easy way for her to sell well every day. From this business sector; she is able to get a profit approximately 3 USD daily. Mrs. Krouch is 60 years old and a married woman. She is a hardworking person for covering her family's expenses. 

Mrs. Krouch is seeking for a loan in amount of $200USD in the purpose to additional her capital to produce more cakes to satisfy her clients at the market. This will be her second loan cycle with the Kiva partner HKL. Mrs. Krouch hopes that this loan will support her family meet her financial needs and improve the quality of her business. Mrs. Krouch describes herself as an easygoing woman who is honorable and very responsible. In the future, she wishes to have a bigger house.

loans.use: to produce more cakes.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Letecia has a retail shop that sells food supplements from HEALTH WEALTH. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy food supplements from HEALTH WEALTH.

Letecia is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Letecia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy food supplements from HEALTH WEALTH

loans.name: Aimalyn

texts.en:
Aimalyn is 30 years old and lives in San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City. She is married with one child.
 
To earn a living, Aimalyn has a business of hog raising. She earns about 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each every three months doing this type of work. 

Aimalyn has requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to purchase pigs for her pig raising business.

Aimalyn has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Aimalyn would like to have a big piggery and agri-veterinarian supply. Aimalyn is a (MIGS) Member in Good Standing of PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase pigs for her pig raising business.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
This is Leonora, 56, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She and her husband Nelson, a taxi driver, have two children. She and her husband  manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Leonora operates a rug-making business. She mainly offers rugs, from round palm-sized ones to much larger doormats, and other crafts that most rug-makers come up for every day. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, they are one of the most common products that you can buy, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney (a small bus) down the highway. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 3500 Phillipines pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 36,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials and supplies like fabric, thread, and other materials for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Leonora hopes to increase production and dreams to be able to give everyone in her family a good life through all of her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en:
Rosalita is 57 years old and lives in Palayan, Aloran Misamis Occidental. She is married with seven children. 

Rosalita has a dried fish retail store. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase materials for her house repair.

Rosalita has been a member of PMPC for five years.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her house repair.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is married and lives with her husband. They are blessed with three children. Marlyn lives in Tagulalo, Aurora Zamboanga del Sur. She is 40 years old.

Tagulalo is a remote area, and the village is surrounded with water. Marlyn sells the fish she catches to earn an income. She has been in this business for five years. Selling fish is her primary source of income. With her business she was able to have a net income of 2500 Philippines pesos (PHP). She experiences ups and downs in life, but she strives hard. She helps her husband in this fishing business.
 
Marlyn is asking for a loan of PHP 5000 to purchase supplies for fishing. Marlyn joined GDMPC in 2009 and she has been a member of GDMPC for two years. Marlyn hopes to buy a pump boat, which would allow her to catch more fish.

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

GDMPC people empowering people.

loans.use: To purchase fishing supplies.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta had a strong determination to succeed. Four years ago, she operated a small sari-sari(variety) store in their village. But, due to the expensive costs of grocery items and minimal profit gained from it, she stopped the business and engaged herself in raising hogs for a higher income. She has been raising hogs, to fatten and sell to butchers in the village, for almost a year. She has been generating an income of PHP2,000 for each hog disposal. 

Julieta wants to strengthen her business and make it more profitable. She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP10,000 to buy hog feed, medicines and vaccines for hogs sustenance and to ensure good nutrition.

Julieta is now 47 years old and is married. She has four children, all attending to school. She wants to provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, medicines and vaccines to ensure good nutrition.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 55, and has five children. Four of her children are married and one is still single and works. She is married, but her husband is not with them due to his furniture shop business at the village of Diffun Quirino. 

Josefina has been operating her general store for almost 15 years. She is thankful because, through this business, she has been able to raise her children and let them finished their degrees. According to her, she opens her store at 4 o'clock in the morning due to those costumer who go to the rice fields. Many of her customers are farmers so, she wakes up early to supply their needs. Her profit increases during crop season because her products sell out immediately and credit is not allowed during crop season.  

One of her greatest problems in managing her store is credit of some of her costumers. This is why she is applying for a loan in the amount of PHP25,000 to buy groceries such as soft drinks, biscuits, canned goods, eggs, cooking oil, ingredients and vegetables needed in her retail store.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as soft drinks, biscuits, canned goods, eggs, cooking oil, ingredients and vegetables needed in her retail store.

loans.name: Heng's Group

texts.en:
This is a loan group with four members that is located in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Mrs. Heng was chosen as the team leader. She is 44 years old and has four children, all of whom live with her. Mrs. Heng runs a massage business and earns approximately 3 USD daily. She is a hardworking woman who can meet her family's expenses with her revenue. 

Mrs. Heng is requesting a 200 USD loan to purchase a motorbike to improve her family's living situation and quality of life. She characterizes herself as an easygoing woman who is honorable and very responsible. This is Mrs. Heng's seventh loan cycle with HKL and the fourth cycle of her Kiva partner loan. In the future, she wishes to have a comfortable house and send her children to finish their university degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
At her young age of 25, Jessie is already blessed with two children. She was not given an opportunity to enter into college due to lack of finances to sustain her education, so she was involved into early marriage. To generate income, her spouse provides motorcycle transport services to the people in the village. Daily income of PHP300 is used for daily allowances for the children and meals.

Jessie has to pay for franchise renewal and to buy accessories, such as side mirrors, for the motorcycle in order to ensure safeness of passengers and to allow her husband to continuously operate the business. She is now asking for a loan of PHP12,000.

In the future, Jessie would like to earn consistent profits for the college education of her children and to someday pursue their chosen career.

loans.use: to pay for franchise renewal and to buy accessories, such as side mirrors, for the motorcycle.

loans.name: Sari Pertami Group

texts.en:
Sari Pertami group is a new pig farmer group numbering 10 members with a  loan amount of Rp.15,000,000. They are joined in groups to get funding and training from MUK. They receive information about pig groups from the groups in other villages.

Ni Ketut, 42 years old, has two children. The first one is married, and the second is in college. Her husband works as a farmer. In addition to helping her husband as a farmer, Ni Ketut pursues efforts to raise pigs. With the loan she bought two pigs that will be bred. She plans to be a piglet seller. Ni Ketut hopes to be able to fix her house with the profits from raising pigs.

loans.use: To buy two pigs.

loans.name: Baktygul's Group

texts.en: Baktygul is the leader of this group. She is 32, and together with her husband, she brings up two children. The older son studies at school and the second children is preschool age (under 7). Baktygul works at school as a teacher of the Kyrgyz language and literature. Seven years ago, with an initial investment of 5000 soms, the family opened a pavilion where they sell grocery goods. In this way, they earn about 7000 soms per month. This profit made it possible to purchase home furniture and cattle for breeding. With money received from the loan, Baktygul wants to purchase more products, such as cookies, canned goods, beverages, etc. In the future, with the profits gained from the trade, she wishes to buy a vehicle to decrease their transportation expenses. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, cookies and canned goods.

loans.name: Artykbubu's Group

texts.en: Artykbubu is the leader of this group. She is 56 and married to a veterinarian. Together they have raised two sons and two daughters. The daughters are married; they live separately with their families. The older son works in Russia and the younger son is engaged in farming. Artykbubu works at a school; she is also engaged in a livestock business. At the moment, she keeps a cow with a calf and 15 farm animals. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase four goats to increase her number of livestock. In the near future, Artykbubu plans to start repairing the house. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase goats.

loans.name: Shamsullo

texts.ru: Шамсулло проживает в районе Вахдат. Ему 35 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он занимается животноводством. Разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности он занимается десять лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Shamsullo lives in the Vahdat region. He is 35 years old. He is married and has three children. His wife is a homemaker. He does animal husbandry. He breeds large horned cattle for resale in the future. He has been in this business for ten years. He is taking out the loan to buy large horned cattle.

loans.use: to purchase large horned cattle.

loans.name: Melati Putih Group

texts.en:
Kadek is 41 years old and lives in Pejarakan, North Bali.  She is married and has three children, aged 25, 17  and 10.  Her two sons are in school and her older son is already married.   Her husband works as a farmer.  Though Kadek often helps her husband, she also raises pigs in her yard to supplement her family’s income.  She has been raising pigs for five years.  

Kadek is the head of the Melati Putih group, which is made up of 10 neighbors from the same village.  This is the group’s first loan with MUK.  With the Rp.1,000,000 that Kadek receives, she will purchase two piglets and pig feed.  She plans to sell the piglets after five months for use as pork.  With her earnings, she plans to purchase more pigs.  With the income from her pig raising, she hopes to be able to pay school fees.

loans.use: To purchase two piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Amartuvshin

texts.en:
Mr. Amartuvshin is a 22-year-old taxi driver in Kherlen, a town of the Dornod province, Mongolia. Also, he is a young father and lives with his wife and 3-year-old daughter. He has been doing his taxi business for three years and could become a skillful driver. It is a main income source of this young family. There is a large number of customers who are served regularly. They all say that Amartuvshin is a friendly, hardworking, good driver who caters fully to the passengers. 

Now he needs to make some adjustments to his car, especially changing the tires to winter ones. There are also some other parts that need to be changed before this winter. It is important to his business so his passengers can be safer in the future.
 
Therefore, he is taking a loan to make adjustments to his taxi car for improving his service.

loans.use: To make adjustments to his taxi car for improving his service.

loans.name: Lkhagvasuren

texts.en:
Mr. Lkhagvasuren, 56, is a taxi driver. He lives with his wife in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been doing this business since he bought his car in 2007. His daily earnings are quite less than his necessities. 

Recently, he has started the building of his new house in the outer part of Ulaanbaatar city. He has a plan to install a low-pressure chimney in his new home. It will use smokeless fuel and will be less harmful to environment. He absolutely cares about the environment's welfare. Due to this, Lkhagvasuren is requesting a loan to cover the payment for the new low-pressure chimney that uses smokeless fuel at his home.

loans.use: To cover the payment for the new low-pressure chimney that uses smokeless fuel in his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase three sacks of rice, cooking fat oil, and charcoal for her food stall.

loans.name: Tursunkhuja

texts.ru: Турсунхуча проживает в районе Вахдат. Ему 29 лет. Он женат. Живет вместе с родителями. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он имеет среднее образование. В основном Турсунхуча занимается перевозками и развозками людей по маршруту Вахдат - Душанбе. В этой области он уже восемь лет. Кредит берет для ремонта автомобиля марки Тангем.
texts.en: Tursunkhuja lives in the region of Vahdat. He is 29 years old. He is married and lives together with his parents. His wife is a homemaker. He has secondary education. Mainly Tursunkhuja transports people via the route Vahdat - Dushanbe. He has been in this business for eight years. He is taking out the loan to repair his car by brand of Tangem.

loans.use: to repair a car by brand of Tangem.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 57 years old, married, and has three children.They live in the province of Isabela where her husband plants rice as the family's primary source of income. 

Virginia is hardworking woman who she raises piglets. Though the hog raising business is difficult to manage, she wakes up early to clean the sty and feed the piglets. She recently started selling meat. 

Virgina is asking for a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP to buy stock feeds for the daily maintenance of her hogs and meat for her vending activity. She hopes that this loan will provide her with an increased income for her family. With the business she manages, she is able to cover up all of her household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase feed stock for daily maintenance of hog raising business and meat for her retailing business

loans.name: Bagdagul's Group

texts.en:
Bagdagul is the treasurer of this group. She is 40, and together with her husband, she brings up a daughter and four sons. The daughter studies at university and the sons are at school. In order to earn money to meet the family needs, the family breeds livestock and then resells it at a higher price after being fattened. They started this activity 16 years ago with an initial investment of 500 soms and now the monthly profit from reselling livestock is about 6500 soms. With money received from the loan, Bagdagul wants to purchase more livestock for breeding, fattening and further reselling. In the future, she wants to provide all her children with a good education.

Where Did This Loan Come From?

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Bayarmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Bayarmaa, 38, who lives in a house with her husband and three children, has been a seller of dishes and lusterware used as household necessities for 15 years. She purchases her commodities from the factories and sells them wholesale.

Bayarmaa has lately been considering an expansion of her business into another marketplace or bazaar. In order to increase her business working capital, she needs to increase her sales volume, and is therefore requesting a loan to purchase more dishes from her suppliers. Her previous four loans from other institutions were all repaid on time.

loans.use: to purchase more dishes from suppliers.

loans.name: Anjelina

texts.en:
Anjelina is married and has eight children. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past six years, Anjelina has operated a food stall, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces major challenges of competition and delayed payments by debtors. She dreams of establishing a poultry business in the future.

Anjelina is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES, which she will use to purchase timber and cement to repair her food stall. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase timber and cement to repair her food stall.

loans.name: Romualda

texts.en:
Romualda is 61 years old, married, and has three children. Romualda is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. She primarily grows rice to sell.
