Romualda is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to have a better income so she can continue supporting her family. She also wishes for her children to finish their studies and be successful.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 37 years old, married, and has three children.  She sells a variety of vegetables within her village. She has been engaged in this business for almost 18 years. Her husband is in charge of their rice fields and transportation business. 

Marites does not spend too much time selling her vegetables because she has a vegetable garden where she also takes her merchandise.  She enjoys her daily routine in cultivating her vegetable garden. Aside from selling vegetables, she is also engaged in the hog raising business, which she has been doing for three years. 

Marites is requesting a loan for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional seeds of squash, okra, string beans, and bitter gourds. This will have a great impact on her business because her profit will increase and her children will be able to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase seeds of squash, okra, string beans, and bitter gourds for her vegetable backyard

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is 48 years old and lives in Villaflor, Oroquieta City. She is married with two children. 

To earn a living, Leonila has a business selling items such as sugar, milk, vegetable oil, canned goods, cigarettes, etc. She earns about 1,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. Leonila has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her grocery store.

Leonila has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Leonila would like to save more coming from the business. Leonila is a good mother and loving wife. She is hardworking and proud to be a member of PMPC because they can help in terms of financial problems anytime.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her grocery store.

loans.name: Aghunik

texts.en: Aghunik is from the village of Arevshat in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is married with three children – two daughters (twelve and sixteen years old) and a seventeen-year-old son.  Aghunik has a high school education and has been engaged in farming for the past fifteen years.  Aghunik also supports her family in the city with products grown on her farm.  She considers herself a hardworking, honest person.  Aghunik is looking for a loan to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizer.  She expects the family income to increase by ten percent with this investment.  She dreams of having her children receive a university education.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is a 54-year-old married woman with five children. The oldest child is 29 years old.

Rufina is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. Rufina is able to buy their basic needs through her income from the farm. She has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. Rufina hopes to continue farming and earning.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 37 years old, married, and has seven children.  She lives in the Philippines. Myrna has a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages . She has had this business for five years. 

Myrna is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Myrna has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Махбуба  вот уже более 20 лет занимается  куплей и продажей национальной посуды. Она узнала  от сотрудников о «Имон Интернешнл» и решила сотрудничать. Махбуба замужем, она любящая жена, заботливая мать, у нее 3 детей. В этом бизнесе участвует муж, и её дети также помогают ей. В будущем она намечает сотрудничать с «Имон Интернешенл» и открыть частную точку.  Она хотела бы получить займ в размере 4700 Сомони для покупки посуды с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Mahbuba has been involved in buying and selling national dishware for over 20 years.  She learned from co-workers about "Imon International" and decided to work with them.  Mahbuba is married.  She is a loving wife and a caring mother.  She has three children.  Mahbuba's husband participates in this business, and their children help as well.  She plans to work together with "Imon International" in the future and open her own store.  She wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 4700 Somoni for the purchase of dishware in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase dishware

loans.name: Sumber Rahayu Group

texts.en:
Sumber Rahayu group is located in the village of Pejarakan, North Bali. This area has very low rainfall, so this dry season  a lot of the farmers' produce was not optimal. Seeing this situation, the Sumber Rahayu group which consists of 10 women, took the initiative to raise pigs in an effort to support the family economy.

Ni Luh, head of the group, 34 years old, has two children. She will uses the loan to buy three piglets to be sold for pork. Pigs are maintained for two months and then are ready for sale. Profits will be used to buy a pig again, so after six months she is ready to make repayment of the loan. She hopes these efforts will help her husband's income, working as a farmer.

loans.use: To buy three piglets.

loans.name: Nargozor's Group

texts.en:
Nargozor is the leader of this group. She is 49 and married to a taxi driver. She has two sons and a daughter. Her daughter and one of her sons work in the private enterprise “Jersey” and the younger son studies at school. Two years ago Nargozor received a livestock inheritance from her parents, and since then she has engaged in livestock breeding. With money received from the loan she will purchase more livestock for breeding, fattening and eventual reselling. In the future she dreams of purchasing an apartment.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is 34 years old, married, and lives in the Philippines. Susan has a shop that sells vegetables, spices and food seasonings. She has had this business for 10 years. Susan requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy spices, food seasonings and vegetables to sell. Susan has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Susan hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy spices, food seasonings and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Ladeslao

texts.en: Ladeslao is 51 years old and lives in Dulapo, Oroquieta City. He is married with 3 children. Ladeslao has a okay-okay (used clothing) business and earns approximately PHP 4,000 each month doing this type of work. He has a requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase more used clothes for his business. Ladeslao has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, Ladeslao hopes to earn a good income from his business. Ladeslao is an honest, hard-working person and he love's his family. He is a MIGS member of PMPC. Ladeslao is a proud member of PMPC because they can help him by providing loans.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Serapia

texts.en:
Serapia is 53 years old and married with three children. The oldest child is 27 years old. 

Serapia makes and sells "tuba" (coconut wine). This business has been running for two years. Each month, Serapia earns 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). Serapia works hard to help provide for her family's needs and to send her children to school. 

She has requested this loan to purchase containers and other materials for making tuba. She hopes for her business to grow bigger.

loans.use: to purchase containers and other materials for making tuba (coconut wine).

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Teresita has a retail shop that sells spices, food seasonings and vegetables. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy spices, food seasonings and vegetables to sell.

Teresita is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Teresita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy spices, food seasonings and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Sadridin

texts.ru: Садридин житель города Вахдат. Ему 52 года. Он женат. У него двое детей. Его жена занимается домашним хозяйством. Сам Садридин имеет средне - специальное образование, шафер. По специальности работает 15 лет. Кроме того он занимается разведением крупнорогатого скота. Разводит скот у себя дома. Этим видом деятельности он занимается восемь лет. Кредит берет для закупа несколько голов бычков.
texts.en: Sadridin lives in the town of Vahdat. He is 52 years old. He is married, with two children. His wife is a homemaker. Sadridin has received a secondary technical education; he is a driver. He has been working in his profession for 15 years. In addition, he raises cattle by his home. He has been doing this for eight years. He is taking out a loan in order to buy several heads of cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with seven children: three boys and four girls. Four of her children attend school while three graduated from school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, she has operated a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to establish another business of selling fish in the future.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to establish a clothes selling business and purchase bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To establish a clothes selling business and purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 29 years old and lives in Labo Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. 

Emma is a buyer of coconuts. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of 14,900 Philippines pesos to purchase more coconut fruits for her business.

Emma has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Emma hopes to have a lot of capital and be a copra (dried meat of the coconut) buyer. Emma is a (MIGS) Member In Good Standing of PMPC. She is a hardworking mother and an honest person who takes good care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more coconut fruits for her business.

loans.name: Lusik

texts.en: Lusik lives in the Shirak region of Armenia in the village of Isahakyan.  She is happily married with three children – a twenty-year-old daughter and two sons (twenty-five and twenty-six years old).  Lusik has been trained to work in the textile industry.  For the past twenty years, she has been farming on the family farm.  She dreams of renovating her home and putting away some funds for her children’s future.  She is looking for a loan to purchase wheat seeds.  Lusik expects this investment to increase the family income by fifteen percent.  She is pleased with the terms and services of microfinance.  Lusik enjoys being a farmer living in her home village.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds

loans.name: Protacio

texts.en:
Protacio is married with four children. Protacio is 43 years old and lives in Sibaroc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

Protacio sells pigs to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Each month, he earns 10,000.00 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. He has requested a loan for 10,000.00 PHP to buy piglets.

Protacio has been a member of PMPC for one year.  n the future, Protacio hopes to become a supplier of pork meat in Jimenez town.

loans.use: To purchase piglets for his piggery.

loans.name: Kabibi

texts.en:
Kabibi is a married woman with five children — one girl and four boys, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a fish and coconuts selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition in her area of operation. She dreams of establishing her own business premises in the future.

With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts and repair her selling stall. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of coconuts and repair her selling stall.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married.

Florenda has a retail shop that sells food seasonings, spices, and vegetables. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy spices, vegetables, and food seasonings.

Florenda is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Florenda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy spices, vegetables, and food seasonings.

loans.name: Ruhizahon's Group

texts.en:
Ruhizahon is the treasurer of this group. She is 38 and married, and her husband works in Russia. She is raising a fourteen-year-old child, who studies at school. Seven years ago, with an initial investment of 3500 Kyrgyzstan soms (KGS), Ruhizahon started breeding livestock. With profits gained from reselling livestock, she was able to repair her house, purchase home appliances, and improve her living conditions. 

With money received from this loan, Ruhizahon wants to purchase more livestock for breeding, fattening, and further reselling. In the future, Ruhizahon wants to provide her son with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 36 years old and married. She has four children. Two are going to school, while the others are too young to attend school. She raises hogs to sell to butchers who come into their village. She usually earns 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) for each hog sold. The minimal profit earned is just enough to cover all their expenses – especially what her children might need for daily allowances. 

Marites is now asking for a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy feed and vitamins to ensure good growth and proper nutrition of her hogs. In the future, she wants to enhance her hog-raising business and make it more profitable. She also wants to save enough capital to construct a convenient pigpen for her hogs.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins to ensure good growth and proper nutrition of hogs.

loans.name: Timotea

texts.en:
Timotea is a 48-year-old married woman with four children. Her oldest child is 19 years old. Timotea earns a living buying and selling fruits and vegetables and she sells her products at the market. 

Timotea is requesting a loan to buy more bananas, cassava, and taro to sell. She hopes to increase her earnings to provide for her children's education and improve her family's house.

loans.use: to buy bananas, cassava, and taro to sell

loans.name: Analou

texts.en:
Analou is 31 years old and is married with three children. She lives in Bitoon, Aguada, Ozamiz City. She runs a business buying and selling bags and earns approximately 30,000 PHP each month. Analou has been a member of PMPC for one year. 

Analou is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan to purchase more bags. In the future, she hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase bags to sell

loans.name: Peregrina

texts.en: Peregrina is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. She has a food shop, or carenderia, that sells viands like chicken & pork adobo, afritada & caldereta. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making her dishes.  Peregrina is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making her dishes

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
This is Rose, 44, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Sonny, a driver, and a mother to her four children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their own household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to save for her children's future.

Rose operates a community pharmacy store. She retails basic medicine and vitamins to the community. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this she also sells mineral water for added income. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan for 16,000 PHP. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional stocks of medicine and mineral water to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Rose hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all of her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of medicine and mineral water needed in her business

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is a 53-year-old married man from Trinidad, Bohol. He makes and sells "bahalina" (coconut wine) for a living. Victor has a coconut farm, which is the source of his bahalina. Victor also tills a parcel of land where he grows rice crops.

Victor has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, bamboo and containers. Victor hopes that through his business, he will be able to provide a better quality of life to his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, bamboo and containers.

loans.name: Irshaad Mae's Group

texts.en:
Irshaad Mae is a working lady who sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She has great skills in her work and receives a good number of orders every month.  

She is married, and her husband has a Punjabi food restaurant. The taste of his food is very good; that’s why he has a good number of clients who come to his restaurant every day. 

Irshaad is the mother of three children: one of them works and earns a reasonable amount of income that helps Irshaad with running her household expenses. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy required ingredients such as spices, rice, lentils and flour in bulk to be able to prepare better quality food and to serve many more customers. 

Irshaad is hopeful that her husband’s business will be established further and it will allow her family to live a better financial life.

loans.use: To buy required ingredients for a Punjabi food restaurant business.

loans.name: Sapiya

texts.ru: Более  трех  лет Сапия занимается куплей и продажей детских вещей. Торговлей она занимается  в местном базаре. Сапия  во второй раз сотрудничает с  «Имон Интернешнл». Она благодарна «Имон Интернешнл»  за сотрудничество. Сапия замужем, её муж в России, чтобы зарабатывать денег, у них 4 детей. В настоящее время у Сапии нет торговой точки, где бы она могла реализоваться. В будущем она планирует продолжить сотрудничество с «Имон Интернешнл»  и открыть торговую точку, где разнообразив свой ассортимент могла вести успешный бизнес. Она хотела бы получит кредит в размере 5000 Сомони для покупки детской одежды.
texts.en: Sapiya has been involved in buying and selling children's clothing.  She sells at the local market.  This is Sapiya's second time working with "Imon International).  She is grateful to "Imon International" for the partnership.  Sapiya is married, her husband is in Russia in order to earn money, and they have four children.  Currently, Sapiya does not have a retail outlet, where she can sell her merchandise.  In the future, she plans to continue the partnership with "Imon International" and open a retail outlet, where, having expanded her merchandise selection, she could run a successful business.  She wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 5000 Somoni to buy children's clothing.

loans.use: to purchase children's clothing

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en: Gohar is from the town of Gyumri in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is married with two children – a twenty-year-old son and a twenty-one-year-old daughter.  Gohar would like to expand her business but does not have the financial means for the required investment.  She has had a small clothing business for the past ten years and would like a loan to increase her inventory.  Gohar expects this investment to increase the family income by thirty percent.  She dreams of purchasing an apartment for her family.  She is proud to be from Gyumri and is grateful for having the access to microfinance.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married.
 
Lucia has a retail shop that sells food seasonings, canned goods and snacks. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Lucia is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Lucia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Abubakr

texts.ru: Абубакр житель города Вахдат. Он женат. Ему 24 года. У него четверо детей. Его жена не работает. Сам Абубакр предоставляет услугу, такси. Этим видом деятельности занимается три года. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины.
texts.en: Abubakr lives in the town of Vahdat.  He is 24 years old, married and has four children.  His wife does not work.  Abubakr provides a taxi service.  He has been involved in this business for three years.  He is requesting this loan to make repairs to his car.

loans.use: to make repairs to his car

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 62 years old and lives in Ibabao, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is divorced with three children. 

Josephine has a shop of clothes to sell. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 14,900 to purchase more clothes for her clothing business.

Josephine has been a member of PMPC for five years.  In the future, Josephine hopes to have a big store of  clothing. Josephine is an honest person. She works hard because of her children and she wants them to finish their studies.She is also a Member in good standing of PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for her clothing business.

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer is a married woman with two boys, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a poultry business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and competition from other poultry operators. She dreams of purchasing a plot to build real estate (rental) houses in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase chicks and medicine for the chicks. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase chicks and medicine for the chicks.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 
Rosenda has a retail shop that sells spices, food seasonings and vegetables. She has run this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy food seasonings, spices and vegetables for resale.
Rosenda is a new member of Kiva partner, HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy food seasonings, spices and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 52 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with six children. 
Nilda sells pigs to earn a living and has run this business for one year. Each month, she earns 10,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase piglets for her piggery.
Nilda has been a member of Kiva partner, PMPC, for six years. In the future, she hopes to provide for her family's needs and send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase piglets for her piggery.

loans.name: Zacarias

texts.en: Zacarias is 52 years old and married. He earns a living through farming. Zacarias tills land located in Trinidad, Bohol. He primarily grows rice crops to sell. Zacarias has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and other farm inputs. He hopes to continue supporting his family through his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
As the married parent of four children, Rebecca works hard to support her family. She has a food-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a sari-sari (variety) store. Rebecca has been sustaining her business with the assistance of 20 previous loans from NWTF. 

Rebecca is requesting a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients to make and sell food. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is 57 years old and lives in Aguada, Ozamiz City. She is a single mother with one child. 
Melba has a retail store and earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase stock for her retail store. 
Melba has been a member of Kiva partner, PMPC, for one year. In the future, she hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her retail store.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 
Jovelyn has a tailoring shop that makes and sells school and office uniforms. She has run this business for ten years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy materials needed for making dresses and uniforms.
Jovelyn is a new member of Kiva partner, HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for making dresses and uniforms.

loans.name: Gisma

texts.en:
Gisma is 28 years old and married with six children, four of whom are in school. She is married to a businessman. She has a business selling tea in Buluk branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Gisma requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to build a shop for her business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase glasses and a kettle to sell tea.

loans.name: Crestituto

texts.en:
Crestituto is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with two children. 
Crestituto has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. He has run this business for one year. He has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Crestituto has been a member of Kiva partner, HSPFI, since 2011. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 41-year-old married man. He lives in Tripoli with his wife and four children. He is a very kind father who loves his family a lot. He works hard at giving his children the best education and a healthy lifestyle. 
Mohamad is a hardworking man who specializes in repairing car bodies through fixing vehicles and applying colors. Mohamad started working in this business 20 years ago. His long experience has earned him his customers' trust and loyalty. His commitment, talent and good standing are characteristics that mark him as special among his competitors. He opened his garage in 2007, and he is working hard on improving his workplace as much as he can. He wants to make it bigger in order to accommodate extra cars in the future.
This is Mohamad's second loan as an Al Majmoua borrower. His previous loan helped a lot in improving his business through buying a new machine that made his work easier. Today Mohamad is requesting a loan to buy paints and materials needed for his business.

loans.use: to buy paints and materials needed for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for his pigs.

loans.name: Glicerio

texts.en:
Glicerio is a 32-year-old married man with 3 children aged 11, 4 and 1. He is a farmer and has been growing rice for 4 years. Glicerio sells his harvest at the market and earns about 5000 PHP per month.

Glicerio has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. He hopes to achieve an abundant harvest. He also hopes to save for his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Rayon

texts.en:
Rayon is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Rayon has a shop that sells different sizes of wood & lumber. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy stocks of wood & lumber in different sizes to sell.
Rayon has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rayon hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of wood & lumber in different sizes to sell

loans.name: Ailen

texts.en:
Ailen is 29 years old and lives in Toril Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children. 
 Ailen works in the pig industry  for a living. She has been doing this for 1 year. She has requested a loan of 7,000 to purchase pigs for her piggery. 
Ailen has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, Ailen hopes to have big capital for her piggery.

loans.use: to purchase pigs for her piggery

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman with three children, two boys and one girl. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a cloth selling business in the future.

With the Kshs 80,000 she wants to purchase a popcorn machine for making popcorn for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a popcorn machine for making popcorn for resale.

loans.name: Anelyn

texts.en:
Anelyn is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 9 children. 
Anelyn has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages . She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages .
Anelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Anelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en: Janeth is 28 years old and married with a 6-year-old child. She started her sari-sari (variety) store business a year ago. Janeth sells items like shampoo, coffee and vinegar to the people in her community. She has requested this loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, shampoo and soft drinks. Janeth hopes for her store to grow bigger. She also hopes to be able to sustain her child's education.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, shampoo and soft drinks.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy is 29 years old and he is single. He was not able to enter college and finish a degree. Instead of lazing at home, he engaged himself in rice farming. He plants and harvests rice and  sell it in advance to traders when he harvests. Being a responsible son, he also gives remittances to his parents. Profits earned are used to pay electric bills and meals for the family. 

In his half-hectare plot of land, he needs to pay for labor costs for those who help him cultivate and prepare for the next planting season and transplant the seedlings. He is now asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy seeds and pay for farm cost.

In the future, he wants to achieve more crop production and save for future expenses. He also wants to have his own family and children to sustain someday.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for farm costs.

loans.name: Rechel

texts.en:
Rechel is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Rechel has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Rechel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rechel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

Helen has been in this business for six years. Helen earns more income from her sari-sari (variety) store.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her businesses.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food production business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Justa

texts.en:
Justa is 28 years old with five children, three of whom are in school. She is a widow. She has a business selling charcoal in Buluk branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years. She also earns some income from selling bread at home.

Justa requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal to sell. She says that the profits from this loan will help her build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en: Susanna is from the village of Ashotck in the Shirak region of Armenia. She is married with a thirty-four-year-old daughter.  Susanna has a secondary education and has been working on the family farm for twenty years.  She is hardworking and honest.  Susanna dreams of buying an apartment for her daughter.  She is looking for a loan to purchase additional livestock.  According to her business plan, this investment will increase the family income by twenty percent.  She is pleased with microfinance services and the terms are reasonable.  The conditions in Ashotck are favorable for raising livestock and additionally for raising a family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 40 years old and married. He has two children aged 9 and 7. Joel has a sari-sari (variety) store business. He sells items like canned goods, vinegar, soy sauce and chips to the people in his community. Joel also tills a small parcel of land where he grows rice crops.

Joel has requested this loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, sugar, shampoo and soap. Joel hopes to expand his store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, sugar, shampoo and soap.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.ru: Хабиба женщина предпринимательница. Бизнесом она занимается уже 2 года. Она занимается куплей и продажей посуды. Хабиба  замужем, имеет 4 детей. В бизнесе помогает ей её дочь. Муж  Хабибы  на заработках в России. Для расширения бизнеса  ей нужны средства, поэтому она решила сотрудничать с «Имон Интернэшнл». Она надеется на поддержку и понимание и заранее благодарит всех за участие в её жизни.
texts.en: Habiba is a businesswoman. She does business for two years. She buys and sells dishware. Habiba is married and has four children. Her daughter helps her with the business. Habiba's husband is now working in Russia. To expand the business she needs financial means and that is why she decided to partner with Imon International. She hopes for the support and understanding and thanks everyone in advance for taking a part in her life.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Nelly has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Nelly has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Nelly hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Rama

texts.en:
Rama is a divorced man with two children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees for the children. 

For the past eight years, he has operated a vegetable stall business, selling at the market to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his place of operation. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 he wants to purchase sacks of potatoes for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Gai's Group

texts.en:
Gai was born in 1958. She lives in Le Phap village, Uy No commune. She has three children. Her husband is a builder. He has income. She grows rice and also raises poultry and sells vegetables in the market. She has this job for many years. She has a monthly income of about 2.000.000 Vietnamdong(VND). Since 2003, she has participated in SEDA and always repaid punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 1.090.000 VND to breed pigs and poultry. She is the leader group of 5-member group loan.

 About other borrowers in her group::
 Tho is 51 years old. she wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to repair her house.
 Hoa is 23 years old. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to expand her store.
 N.  is 61 years old. She has 5 children. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to breed pigs.
 Thuong is 29 years old. She has 4 children. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to breed pigs and poultry

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Madelyn has a shop that sells rice & flour per kilogram. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy sacks of rice & flour to sell.
Madelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Madelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice & flour to sell

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a 39 year-old married man, living with his wife and two children in Tripoli. Imad opened a Barber shop 15 years ago, and he's just doing fine to insure his continuity in this field.
This is Imad's first time to request a loan from Al Majmoua, and it's because he is planning to do new decorations to his shop, and to buy new beauty cosmetics and perfumes requested by his customers.
Imad is very respected man, he works hard on  keeping this respect among his customers, he is a man with a good reputation.
Imad's family supports him a lot to improve his business, and he replies with the best treatment.
He hopes to expand his business more to cover all of his family and business expenses in a very professional way.

loans.use: To do new decorations for his shop, in addition to buying new cosmetics and perfumes

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
Anabel is married with 2 children. Anabel is 35 years old and lives in Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.
Anabel sells Dried Fish to earn a living and has had this business for 4 years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000.00 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 3,000.00 to buy dried fish for her retail business.
Anabel has been a member of PMPC for 1 year.  In the future, Anabel hope to become a supplier of dried fish in the whole Jimenez town.

loans.use: To purchase dried fish for her retail business

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a divorced woman with one child who attends school. She lives at a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation of products in her business. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with seven children. 

Gina has a shop that sells used clothing or "ukay-ukay". She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy used clothing to sell.

Gina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Gina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy used clothing or "ukay-ukay" to sell.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is a 53-year-old married woman with one child. She has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for six years. Juana sells items like canned goods, eggs and spices to the people in her community. She is also a rice retailer.

Juana has requested this loan to purchase five sacks of rice to sell. Juana hopes to continue earning from her store. She also hopes to be able to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to purchase five sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Heghnar

texts.en: Heghnar is a hardworking sole entrepreneur who has been running her shop in Gyumri, Armenia for the past five years.  She is married with four children – three daughters (twenty-five, twenty-nine and thirty years old) and a twenty-three-year-old son.  Heghnar has a high school education and has decided to grow her business.  She is looking for a loan to purchase a refrigerator for her shop.  Heghnar expects the investment to increase her income by twenty percent.  She is pleased with the microfinance services.  Heghnar dreams of renovating her home and opening a second shop in Gyumri.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent bills and food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a charcoal selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her charcoal business in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Bevita

texts.en:
Bevita is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Bevita has a shop that sells fruit, vegetables & bananas. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy fruit, coconuts & vegetables to sell.

Bevita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Bevita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit, coconuts & vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Mernalyn

texts.en:
Mernalyn is 35 years old and married with two children.

Mernalyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Mernalyn has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the rice business for six years and also earns an income from a networking business (Avon).

Mernalyn aspires to save money to expand her businesses and send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Дилафруз самостоятельная предприимчивая женщина. Она замужем имеет 2 детей. Муж Дилафруз на заработках в России. Дилафруз занимается куплей и продажей детской и женской одежды. У неё собственный, налаженный бизнес. Она старается изменить жизнь в лучшую сторону, помогает этим мужу. Для того чтобы улучшить жизнь, развить бизнес она просит займ в размере 2000$ США.
texts.en: Dilafruz is an independent and entrepreneurial woman.  She is married and has two children.  Dilafruz's husband is working in Russia.  Dilafruz is involved in buying and selling children's and women's clothing.  She has her own, stable business.  She tries to change her life for the better and helps her husband.  In order to improve her life and develop her business, Dilafruz is requesting a loan in the sum of $2000.

loans.use: to purchase women's clothing

loans.name: Rambu

texts.en:
Rambu is a 35-year-old seamstress, married to Joni, a 38-year-old man. They have been blessed with three children: Yordan, age 12, studying in the first grade of junior high school; Jordy, age 10, studying in the fourth grade of elementary school; and Ella, age 8, studying in the second grade of elementary school. 

Rambu has been involved in her business for three years. Prior to starting the business, Rambu attended a sewing course. She receives orders for ladies clothing such as gowns, uniforms, skirts, blouses, etc. According to Rambu, her business is running well and the customers are happy with her work, but currently Rambu does not have a hemming machine. Fortunately, her neighbor is willing to allow Rambu to use her machine. Rambu is planning to purchase a new hemming machine for the continuity of her business. 

Rambu heard that TLM assists entrepreneurs who want to improve their small businesses. She got interested in joining the Individual Lending Program and requested a loan of 7,500,000 Indonesian rupiah from TLM. She hopes that her loan application will be approved by TLM soon.

loans.use: to purchase a new hemming machine

loans.name: Jennyruth

texts.en:
JennyRuth is 43-years-old and lives in Burgos St. Aguada, Ozamiz City. She is a widow with 3 school-age children. 

JennyRuth has a general store business and earns approximately 8,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 20000 PHP to purchase stock for her general store.

JennyRuth has been a member of PMPC for 4 year. In the future, JennyRuth hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her general store.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana is 57-years-old and is a married woman with 7 children. She has a sari-sari store business in Trinidad, Bohol. Marciana sells items like softdrinks, soy sauce and vinegar. Marciana also provides tailoring services to her community.

Marciana has requested this loan to buy cloth and tailoring materials, canned goods, noodles and more items to sell. Marciana hopes for her businesses to grow.

loans.use: to buy cloth and tailoring materials, canned goods, noodles and more items to sell.

loans.name: Abizeranye/ruguti Group

texts.fr:
Fiacre fait partie du groupe Abizeranye /Ruguti. Le nom du groupe signifie « ceux qui ont la confiance entre eux ». Il a 44 ans, il est marié avec 5 enfants de 6 à 15 ans, dont 5 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est 8 ans de primaire. 
 Fiacre est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 
Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser des semences sélectionne, cultiver peu d’espace et récolter une grande quantité. Dans les prochaines années, Fiacre voudrait être parmi les meilleurs cultivateurs de riz dans sa vallée. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer ses enfants.
texts.en:
Fiacre is part of the Abizeranye/Ruguti group. The name of the group means "those who have confidence in one another". He is 44 years old, married and has 5 children whose ages range from 6 to 15, all 5 of whom attend school. He himself attended 8 years of primary school.
Fiacre grows rice. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He will use his loan to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice growing. 
His strategy for buisness growth is to use select seeds, grow in a small area and get a large harvest. In the coming years, he Fiacre would like to be one of the best rice growers in his valley. With his profits, he plans to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farm

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Alma works hard to support her family. She has a scrap iron and plastics business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Alma is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy scrap metal and plastic for her recycling business.

Alma has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy scrap metal and plastic for her recycling business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Гульнора жительница города Вахдат. Ей 34 года. Она замужем. У нее 5 детей. Гульнора уже два года как занимается торговлей на рынке. У нее имеется торговая точка, где она продает продукты питания. Кредит берет для покупки конфет, вафель, натуральных соков и молочной смеси.
texts.en: Gulnora lives in the town of Vahdat.  She is 34 years old, married and has five children.  Gulnora has been involved in sales at the market for two years.  She has a retail outlet, where she sells food products.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of candy, waffles, natural juices and dairy mixture.

loans.use: to buy candy, waffles, natural juices and dairy mixture

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 55-years-old and lives in P-4 Gango, Ozamiz City. She is married with 4 children.
 
Elma has a motorcycle business and earns approximately PHP 3000.00 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase one unit of motorcycle. 

Elma has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Elma hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase one unit of motorcycle.

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna is 41-years-old and is a married woman with 3 children. The oldest child is 16-years-old. 

Erna is in the business of raising hogs. She earns about 6000 PHP from this business. Erna also runs a small sari-sari store business. She sells items like vinegar, soy sauce and canned goods to the people in her community. Erna has requested this loan to buy pig feed and more items to sell such as canned goods and noodles. She hopes for her business to progress. She also hopes to be able to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and more items to sell such as canned goods and noodles.

loans.name: Lezl

texts.en:
Lezl is 41-years-old and lives in Taraka, Jimenez Misamis Occidental. She is married with 1 child. 

To earn a living Lezl has a business selling Longganiza. She earns about PHP 3,000.00 each month doing this type of work. Lezl has  requested a loan of 4,000 to purchase sausage for her food stall.

Lezl has been a member of PMPC for 1 year.  In the future, Lezl would like to have a number of food stalls in the town.

loans.use: to purchase sausage for her food stall.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 32 years old and married with five children, four of whom are in school. She has a business selling tomatoes and onions in Buluk branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Lilian requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that the profits from this loan will help her build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more tomatoes and onions to sell

loans.name: Leonito

texts.en:
Leonito is 33 years old and married. He raises hogs to sell to butchers who come to his village. He has been in this business for almost five years. He usually earns a profit of 3,000 PHP for each hog he sells. According to him, the expensive cost of goods and the needs of his children make him work harder to generate income.

He is now asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy feed, vitamins, and medicines for hogs in order to ensure good nutrition. This loan will be a great help for him to improve his hog-raising business.

In the future, Leonito would like to send his three children to college so they can pursue their own career someday.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and medicines for hogs

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a hard-working woman. She is 47 years old and married to a farmer. For almost 20 years, she has run a store. She's thankful because every day she makes her small business grow so that she can improve her quality of life. 

Luzviminda has been blessed with two children. Through her business she is able to provide a higher level of education for her children. She still wants to improve her store by buying inventory of groceries such as soft drinks, biscuits, cooking oil, sugar, canned goods, milk, and baked breads. However, her income is not sufficient to purchase these items due to their high cost and her other household expenses. For these reasons, she is seeking a loan of 30,000 PHP. She hopes that she can provide all the groceries her customers need so that she can attract more customers to her store. Through continuous marketing, she can make her business more profitable. 

Luzviminda is looking forward to increasing her income day by day so that she can provide for all the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her store

loans.name: Lucresia Group

texts.en:
Lucresia is 57 years old and lives in Talinga, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and has eight children.

To earn a living, Lucresia has a business making and selling snacks such as hot cakes and other snacks. She sells these products in her community. She earns about 2,000 PHP each month doing this work. Lucresia has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase juice, sugar, flour, and other ingredients for hot cakes.

Lucresia has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Lucresia would like to have good living conditions and provide her children with the education to become professionals. Lucresia is the leader of a two-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: To purchase juice, sugar, flour, and other ingredients to make hot cakes

location.town: Talinga, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 48 years old and married with eight children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

Editha has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from hog raising.

Editha aspires to save money to expand her businesses.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To increase his capital and to buy a lot of hardware (padlock, nails, junction-boxes, accessories for electric wiring)

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 47 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Edna has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Edna requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items like shoes, blouses, curtains, etc..

Edna has been in this business for five years. In the future, Edna would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more items like shoes, blouses, curtains, etc.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en: Felisa is married with 7 children. She is 61 years old and lives in Farmington, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. She owns a retail store which she has been running for 15 years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase more stock, such as cases of soft drinks to sell. Felisa has been a member of PMPC for over a year. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock, such as cases of soft drinks to sell

loans.name: You

texts.en:
Mr. You is a 28-year-old single man who resides in Kompong Speu province. Presently, Mr. You lives with his mother and he occasionally assists his mother in her crop-planting business according to the season, rainy or dry season, when he has extra time from his sales business. To earn a living, Mr. You is a charcoal seller and he spends most of his time transporting his goods to sell in the market place. 

Mr. You would like to ask for a loan in order to purchase charcoal for resale and with any remainder, he will to buy a few sacks of fertilizer so his mother's rice crop will grow well. In the future, he hopes he will be able to afford a better trailer to carry his charcoal, and also hopes to expand his existing house. 

Note: Mr. You and his mother are in the photo together in front of their house.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale and buy a few sacks of fertilizer for his mother's rice crop.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is from the village of Anoushavan in the Shirak region of Armenia.  Mariam is married with two sons (nineteen and twenty-six years old).  She has a high school education and has been working on the family farm for fifteen years.  Mariam supports her relatives living in the city with products grown on her farm.  Mariam was born in Anoushavan and lives close to her relatives.  She has many good friends and enjoys the village life.  Mariam would like a loan to purchase seeds for the autumn growing season.  She expects this investment to increase the family income by ten percent.  Mariam is pleased with the microfinance services, especially loan collection in the villages.

loans.use: to purchase seeds

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 54 years old and married with six children. With two children in school, Rosalinda works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalinda runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Rosalinda has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, detergents and other groceries. 

In the future Rosalinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ihbal's Group

texts.en:
Ihbal is the treasurer of this group. She is 44 and together with her husband she has raised two sons. Both sons are married; the first son lives separately with his family and the second son lives with Ihbal. In order to earn money the family cultivates potatoes and apples. They also breed and sell livestock when there is a need for additional funds. Ihbal started to breed livestock twenty years ago with an initial investment of 25,000 Kyrgyzstani soms (KGS). In the beginning she kept a cow and three sheep; now she has two cows, a calf and 23 sheep. Ihbal applied for this loan because she needs money to purchase more livestock for breeding. In the future, with the profits gained from reselling livestock, she plans to purchase a vehicle for her family.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for breeding.

loans.name: Gorgonia

texts.en:
Gorgonia is 42 years old and has six children. Gorgonia is married and has five children who are in school.

Gorgonia is in the agricultural business raising cattle in the Philippines. Gorgonia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase cattle and livestock feed.

Gorgonia has been raising cattle for 10 years now and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Gorgonia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and livestock feed.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Tasrin

texts.en:
Tasrin is a 37-year-old fisherman, married to Narni, a 35-year-old lady. From their marriage, they are blessed with three children: Razak, 13; Rahayu, 12; and Farzan, 4. Both Razak and Rahayu are still at school.

Tasrin and his family live in a coastal area. He usually fishes from 5 pm to 3 am. But if the weather is bad, then he will be home earlier. Tasrin has a boat to support his work, but sometimes he faces difficulty fishing as the machine is stuck so he cannot catch fish. Therefore, he is seeking a loan of 3,000,000 Indonesian rupiah from TLM. Tasrin plans to repair the machine and trawl because without these two things he won’t be able to work. He is expecting that TLM will assist him by providing the loan in order to implement his plan.

loans.use: to repair the machine and trawl

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 40 years old and married with two children.

Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Josephine has borrowed and repaid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Josephine aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Joanne

texts.en:
Joanne is a hardworking mother who raises hogs as a primary source of income. Despite poverty, she still thinks of positive outlooks towards life. She believes that someday, she will lift her family out of poverty. Joanne is now 41 years old and has three children who attend school; two are in secondary school and one is in elementary school. 

She raise hogs for future sale and usually earns about 3,000 Philippines pesos (P) for each hog she sells. She wants to enhance her business and make it more profitable; that is why she is now asking for a loan of P25,000 to buy additional hogs to raise and to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines to ensure good nutrition.

Joanne would like to have a stable source of income to save profits for the college education of her children to finish a degree and seek good employment someday.

loans.use: to buy additional hogs to raise and to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines to ensure good nutrition.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 41 years old, married and has five children of whom two are in school.

Lourdes has a Seaweeds "Guso" business in the Philippines. Lourdes requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for her boat to repair.

Lourdes has been in this business for 8 years. Lourdes would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair her boat.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To increase his capital and to buy and resell a lot of cooking vegetal oil boxes in order to make big profits.

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Ludivina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,500 through NWTF to purchase fabric, clothing and other materials for her tailoring business.

Ludivina has been in this business for five years. She earns additional income from selling fruits and vegetables.

Ludivina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to buy an additional sewing machine in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, clothing and other materials.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy, 35, is married and has one child who is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Mercy has a business selling vegetables in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years.

Mercy requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her stall.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en: Gayane lives in the Shirak region of Armenia in the village of Arevshat.  She is married with two children – an eight-year-old daughter and a seven-year-old son.  Gayane has a high school education and has been a sole entrepreneur for the past twelve years.  She supports her relatives in the city with agricultural products.  Gayane would like to expand her business with a loan to purchase wheat seeds.  Planting the seeds in autumn, Gayane expects the family income to increase by fifteen percent in the spring.  She likes living in Arevshat and is surrounded by her relatives and close friends.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds

loans.name: Dalila

texts.en:
Dalila is 44 years old, married and has four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Dalila has been raising pigs for four years and also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Dalila is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional piglets, vitamins and feed.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional piglets, vitamins and feed.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
This is Mary Ann, 41, resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Claro, and mother to three children. She, together with her husband, manage their own household while operating their business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Mary Ann operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piece-meal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns her profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 11,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory and for the maintenance of her sewing machine. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Mary Ann hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to sell, and for the maintenance of her sewing machine

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 26 years old and married. She has two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Jennifer has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish.

Jennifer is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional piglets and feed.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: buy additional piglets and feed.

loans.name: Pepita

texts.en:
Pepita has had a sewing business for almost 20 years. She is 62 years of age and married. Though sometimes she may feel too old to have this business still she enjoys sewing different kinds of clothes for kids, women and men. According to her, she could improve their standard of living through her business. 

She would like to buy additional garments and threads needed in her sewing business but her income goes to their household expenses and payment for electric bills, so that's why she is requesting a loan in the amount of P10,000. With this loan, she could improve the quality of her finished products so that she could sell them at a higher price. She hopes that she can encourage more customers to have a dress made by her.

She believes that through her hard work she could uplift her family's life-style into a better living standard, and she could save some for security purposes for when she gets older.

loans.use: to buy garments and threads needed in her sewing business

loans.name: Ivony

texts.en:
Ivony, a 26-year-old lady is married to Esron, a 28-year-old man. They have one lovely daughter, namely, Freelyn, 3 years old. Ivony and family are living with her parent.

Ivony owns a small kiosk near her residence. She has been running the business since 2008. She started the business to help her husband generate income for their family. In the kiosk, Ivony sells daily needs items such as wheat flour, eggs, detergent, coffee, sugar, cooking oil, mobile phone recharges, etc. She operates the business from 7 am to 6 pm. 

Ivony plans to improve her business by adding more stock for her kiosk as demanded by her customers, but currently she does not have enough money to do so. Therefore, Ivony is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 Indonesian rupiah from TLM. She would like to spend the loan on snacks, instant noodles, tea, biscuits, soap, etc. She is hoping that TLM will help her improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock such as snacks, instant noodles, tea, biscuits, soap, etc.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 25 years old and married. She has two children.

Mercy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She has been running the sari-sari store for six years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

Mercy has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Mercy aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Juddy Thura

texts.en: Juddy is a 53 year old married woman. She has 2 children, aged 31 and 35. She describes herself as jovial, successful, honest, and dedicated. She operates a butcher shop and restaurant, and has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located at Bondeni Market in Nakuru. Her biggest challenge is the loss of customers in the restaurant business. She will use her KES 50,000 loan to buy meat, cooking fat and maize flour. She hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her rental properties, expand her restaurant and educate her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy meat, cooking fat and maize flour.

loans.name: Bonifacio Jr.

texts.en:
Bonifacio is 47 years old and is married. He has eight children, five of them are attending school and the rest have their own families and live by their own. Bonifacio has the drive and attitude to succeed. He spends most of his time raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for future merchandise. He had been doing this for almost 10 years and usually earns a yield twice a year during the months of May and November.

He is now asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy crude oil for machines used in land cultivation, and to buy seeds and fertilizers used in farming. He needs to improve his crop production and generate more income to provide enough sustenance for the education of his children. 

In the future, Bonifacio would like to yield better crops every harvest season and achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy oil for machines used in land cultivation, and to buy seeds and fertilizers used in farming

loans.name: Firdavs

texts.ru:
Фирдавс  20 лет уже занимается продажей промышленных товаров (радиоаппаратура).
Приобретением другой прибыли в семье ему помогает отец. Он сварщик в месяц зарабатывает от 700 до 810 сомони. Фирдавс женат имеет 3 детей, также с ним проживают его родители. Фирдавс честный, трудолюбивый человек в месяц он получает от 1800 до 1900 сомони. Он хочет разнообразить ассортимент товара и тем самым расширить бизнес и для этого  хочет получить займ. Фирдавс заранее благодарит вас за поддержку.
texts.en: Firdavs has been involved in selling industrial products (radio equipment) for 20 years.  His father helps him to obtain additional profits for the family.  He is a welder and earns from 700 to 810 somoni per month.  Firdavs is married and has three children, and his parents live with him as well.  Firdavs is an honest and hard-working person and earns from 1800 to 1900 somoni per month.  He wants to expand the assortment of his merchandise and thus, expand his business, and wants to obtain a loan for this purpose.  Firdavs thanks you for the support.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 36 years old and married. She has two children.

She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Nancy has been buying and selling livestock for six years and also earns additional income from a sari-sari (variety) store.

Nancy is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a 40-year-old married woman with 6 children aged between 8 and 20. Merlinda has a sari-sari (variety) store business in Trinidad, Bohol. She sells bottled water, chips, sugar, vinegar and other various products to the people in her community.

Merlinda has requested this loan to buy more items to sell such as bottled water, canned goods, vinegar and eggs. She hopes to expand her store in the future. She also hopes to be able to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as bottled water, canned goods, vinegar and eggs

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 26 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She has a business selling groundnut paste in Buluk branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years.

Lilian requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her build a house for her children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more groundnut paste to sell

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 43 years old and married. She has four children.

Annie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She has been running the sari-sari store for three years and also earns an income from buying and selling dried fish and fattening pigs. 

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

Annie has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Annie aspires to save money to expand her business.
