loans.use: To buy items to sell.

loans.name: Riad

texts.en:
Riad is a 44-year-old married man, living with his wife and four children in Tripoli. Riad opened a barber shop 15 years ago, and he's working hard to improve his business. This is Riad's first time to request a loan from Al Majmoua, and it's because he wants to buy new products necessary for his business such as gel, shampoo, hair creams, and many other useful things requested by his customers. Riad is a very kind and honest man. He works hard to provide the best customer care. 

This is his first time to request a loan from Al Majmoua. His business is a major support for his family, which is why he has to put much effort on improving it. Riad hopes to keep on improving his business and attracting new customers. His sense of humor is well known to his customers; it's the most important characteristic of his personality. He also plans to expand his business to meet all his customers needs, through adding beauty therapy and many other new services.

loans.use: To buy necessary products for his business

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 51 years old and married. She has five children.

Elvira works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines  She has been running the sari-sari store for 20 years and also earns an income from buying and selling coconuts.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell in her sari-sari store.

Elvira has borrowed and repaid 26 loans from NWTF before this loan.

Elvira aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks to sell.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 44 years old and married. She has four children and three are in school. Estrella works very hard to provide for them.

Estrella runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, noodles, soap, sugar, etc. 

She requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her sari-sari store.

In the future, Estrella would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Abahuje/mgz Group

texts.fr:
Daniel fait partie du groupe Abahuje/MGZ. Le nom du groupe signifie « ceux qui sont ensemble ». Il a 35 ans et il est marié avec 5 enfants de 4 à 13 ans, dont 3 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est 8 ans de primaire. 

Daniel est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques et payer la main d’œuvre pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de semer au temps. Dans les prochaines années, Daniel voudrait être parmi les meilleurs cultivateurs de riz en récoltant la grande quantité du riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer ses enfants et les soignes.
texts.en:
Daniel is part of the group called Abahuje/MGZ. The name of the group means "those who are together". Daniel is 35 and married with five children from 4 to 13 years old, of whom three are enrolled in school. He himself attended eight years of primary school. 

Daniel grows rice. This is his first loan with ACB. He plans to use his loan to buy chemical fertilizer and pay for labor for his rice crop. 

His strategy for the growth of his business is to plant at the right time. In the coming years, Daniel would like to be among the best rice growers by growing a large quantity of rice. With the profit, he intends to educate and care for his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer and pay for labor for his rice crop.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.en:
This is Ma.Teresa, 45, resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. She is a single parent with three children. She, together with her children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ma.Teresa operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She makes money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also sells electronic cell phone loads (prepaid cell phone credits) and offers direct-selling products to her customer. Her store is adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She has a minimum of PHP 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Ma.Teresa hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams to be able to give her children a high-quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Romillo

texts.en:
Romillo, 49 strives hard to provide sustenance for his family. He had been blessed with three children. Though his family is less fortunate, they still live comfortably and help each other to overcome all challenges in their lives. 

Romillo raises crops. He has been planting rice and selling it to traders in the village. As of now, he has insufficient funds to buy seeds, pesticides, and herbicides used in farming. Thus, he is asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy these inputs for crop production improvement.

With his patience, sacrifices, hard work, and strong faith in God, he will be able to lift his family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy seeds, pesticides, and herbicides used in farming.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 49 years old, married with 9 children, 2 of whom are still in school. 

Letecia is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She sells fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 12 years. Letecia requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell.

In the future, Letecia would like to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of  fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Mary Suzette

texts.en:
Mary Suzette is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years. Mary Suzette earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business. Mary Suzette has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to proviD. a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 40 years old and married with three children, all of whom are in school. She has a business selling bread in Buluk branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Flora requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business and purchasing more bread to sell. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more bread to sell

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, married and lives with his wife, his child and one of his family members.

Haydar has owned a blacksmith workshop since 2008. He has more than three years experience in this field, and a good reputation and is well known in his area.

He is requesting an 1,800 USD loan in order to purchase an electric diesel generator for his workshop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase an electric diesel generator for his workshop

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is married with four children. She is 53 years old and lives in Compra, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. Anita owns a retail store to earn a living and has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns 3,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase stock to sell.

Anita has been a member of PMPC for more than one year. In the future, Anita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell

loans.name: Armelinda

texts.en:
Armelinda is 54 years old and married with 9 children.

Armelinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a 28,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Armelinda has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 20 years and also earns an income from buying and selling vegetables.

Armelinda aspires to build and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase items to sell in her store

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.en:
Rosa Maria is a 34-year-old married woman with four children. She is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. Rosa Maria has been growing and selling rice for 10 years. She earns about 7000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month from farming.

Rosa Maria has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes this loan will help improve their harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en: Larisa is from the village of Ashotck in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is happily married with four children – two daughters (forty and forty-two years old) and two sons (thirty-six and thirty-eight years old).  Larisa has a secondary education and has been farming for the past forty years.  She also supports her relatives living in the city with produce grown on the family farm.  Larisa would like a loan to purchase animal feed and fix the livestock shed.  She expects this investment to increase the family income by fifteen percent.  Larisa is pleased with the services of microfinance, especially that the loan payments are collected in the village.  Larisa really enjoys the life of a farmer living in Ashotck.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine works hard to support her family. She is single and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Christine has been in this business for 5 years now.

Christine requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy an additional fishing boat.

In the future, Christine would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy a fishing boat

loans.name: Leizel

texts.en:
Leizel is 25 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past five years, Leizel has run a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and she also earns an income from buying and selling rice. Leizel has borrowed and repaid seven previous loans from NWTF.

Leizel is requesting a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell

loans.name: Sosik

texts.ru:
Сосик родился в 1961 г. в городе Капане, где окончил восемь классов средней школы. После чего он поступил в профтехучилище, где получил специальность маляра. 
Сосик женат, двое его сыновей и дочь живут отдельно со своими семьями. 
Сосик работает по на найму на одной из частных ферм и, параллельно, занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельностью в деревне Вардаванк Сьюникского района. 
Жена помогает ему на их ферме и благодаря совместным усилиям они разводят крупный рогатый скот, кур, овец, а также выращивают овощи и фрукты. 
Сосик реализует говядину, баранину, курятину, молоко, яйца, овечью шерсть, овощи и фрукты своим постоянным клиентам в городе Капане. Часть полученной сельскохозяйственной продукции приобретают скупщики с Капанского городского рынка. 
Сосик получает кредит от Kiva во второй раз и сейчас ему необходим кредит на сумму 1.000.000 драм для покупки трех коров.
texts.en: Sosik was born in 1961 in the town of Kapan, where he completed eight years of secondary schooling.  After that, he went to a professional technical college and obtained a specialty of a painter.  Sosik is married, and two of his children lives separately with their own families.  Sosik is employed at one of the private farms and, parallel to that, is involved in an agricultural business in the Vardavank village in the Syunik district.  His wife helps him with the farm work, and, thanks to their joint effort, they breed cattle, chickens, sheep and also grow vegetables and fruits.  Sosik sells beef, lamb, chickens, milk, lamb woof, vegetables and fruits to his loyal customers in the town of Kapan.  Distributors from the Kapan city market buy part of his agricultural products.  Sosik is requesting a loan from Kiva for the second time and now needs a loan in the sum of 1 000 000 dram for the purchase of three cows.

loans.use: to purchase three cows

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 46 years old and married with one child. She has been engaged in a hog-raising business for six years. While she is busy raising piglets, her husband is responsible for their rice fields. 

Marilyn would like to raise all of her 20 piglets until they reach their optimum growth but her income is not enough due to the high cost of basic commodities, so she is asking for financial assistance in the amount of P30,000 to buy feed for her growing piglets. She is hoping that she could raise them and offer them at a higher price so that she could save some money to ensure her financial security and provide for her family needs.

loans.use: to buy feed for her growing piglets

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is 31 years old and is married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past ten years, Michelle has run a furniture shop in the Philippines. 

Michelle is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her furniture shop. In the future, she would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her furniture shop

loans.name: Seraphine Kavithe

texts.en:
Seraphine is a 51-year-old married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 13 years to 30 years. She describes herself as innovative and patient. She operates a general store where she sells bananas, potatoes, bread, beverages and other items. She has been involved in this business for 16 years. Her business is located within a shopping centre in Thika. She describes her biggest business challenge as low sales volumes especially when the neighbouring schools are on vacation, since they are her major customers. 

Seraphine will use this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to purchase bananas to increase her stock and meet the high demand for bananas by her customers. Her business goal is to grow her business to a wholesale and become the supplier of bananas in her area. She wants to build her own business premises. She hopes that in the future she will be able to teach her children business skills that will help them thrive in self-employment.

loans.use: to buy bananas

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 49 years old and married with four children. Nida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling recycled materials in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy more recycled materials to sell.

Nida has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the recycled materials business for five years and also earns an income from candy making.

Nida aspires to save enough money to buy motorcycle for her business.

loans.use: To buy more recycled materials to sell.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is 57 years old and a widow with four children. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Olivia is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Olivia has been farming vegetable for five years and also earns additional income from buying and selling flowers.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Khosamoh

texts.ru: Хосамох трудолюбивая, самостоятельная женщина, вот уже семь лет она занимается  откормом скота. Хосамох заботливая мать у нее есть один ребенок. Она развелась с мужем,  некому позаботится о ней, она сама еще водитель подрабатывает таксистом. Вот уже  третий раз она получает займ. Она сама занимается этим бизнесом. Для расширения бизнеса она хотела бы получить займ в размере 1500$.  Она планирует использовать займ для покупки запчастей для машины и овца. Она надеется, что Кива не откажет ей в помощи, поэтому заранее благодарит вас за понимание.
texts.en: Khosamoh is a hard-working and independent woman who has now been engaged in raising livestock for seven years. Khosamoh is a good mother to her one infant. She divorced her husband and with non one to take care of her, she still works part-time as a taxi driver. She is getting a loan for the third time. She is involved in this business by herself. To expand the business, she would like to get a loan of $1,500. She plans to use the loan to buy sheep and spare parts for her car. She hopes that Kiva does not refuse her help, so thank you in advance for your understanding.

loans.use: Buying sheep and spare parts for the car.

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.en:
Cleofe is married with four children. She is 57 years old and lives in Palomoc, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay.

Cleofe owns a general store to earn a living and has been in business for 10 years.  She requests a loan to purchase additional stock to sell to customers.

Cleofe has been a member of PMPC since earlier this year.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks for her general store.

loans.name: Ronelio

texts.en:
Ronelio, 37, resident in Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. He is married to Josephine, a house wife and mother to their 4 children. Two study in elementary school while the other two are at home. 

Ronelio is a fish vendor who buys different kinds of fish at wholesale prices and sells them by the kilo.  He buys at the local fish port and sells early in the morning using his tricycle. There are many patrons who prefer Ronelio’s products since they are fresh and clean. His regular customers are neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of 800 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales daily.

To help him continue operating his business, he is requesting a Php 8,000 loan to buy more fish to sell. He expects a boost in income as he expands his business.  
---------------------------------------------------------

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  Group are composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay their micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of fish he needed in his business.

loans.name: Niginamo

texts.ru: Нигинамо ответственная и предприимчивая женщина. В бизнесе она 11 лет. С 2000 по 2005 года она занималась продажей продовольственных товаров, позже  стала  заниматься куплей и продажей парфюмерии и кондитерских изделий. Она в разводе, у нее 3 детей. В бизнесе ей помогает дочь Муниса, которой 20 лет. Нигинамо  очень честная, трудолюбивая, поэтому имеет хорошую репутацию среди родных и знакомых. Нигинамо хочет обеспечить детей хорошей жизнью и будущим, развить бизнес, поэтому просит 2100$ США для увеличения товарооборота. Нигинамо благодарит вас заранее за  поддержку и помощь.
texts.en: Niginamo is a responsible and business oriented woman. She is in business eleven years. Since 2000 to 2005 she has been selling household goods and later began to buy and sell perfumes and confectioneries. She is divorced and has three children. Her daughter Munisa who is 20 years old helps her in the business. Niginamo is very honest and hardworking and it's the reason why she has a good reputation among her relatives and friends. Niginamo wants to provide her children with good life and future, develop her business and is asking for a loan in the amount of $2100 USD to increase her sales volume. Niginamo is thanking all of you in advance for the support and help.

loans.use: to purchase new merchandise.

loans.name: Mawar Merah 3 Group

texts.en: Anita has been selling nasi uduk (an Indonesian rice dish) since 2006. She is 37 years old and married with two children. The older one, eight years old, is in the third grade. The youngest one, five years old, doesn't go to school yet. She runs her business from her house. Up to now, the business has been growing well and more customers have been coming. From this business, she can help supplement her husband's income and contribute to buying items for daily needs. With this loan, Anita wants to expand her menu by adding fresh juice. In the future, she wants to open a kiosk or general store. For her family, she hopes she and her husband can send their children to school through college. Anita is in the middle, wearing a yellow shirt.

loans.use: to pay for fresh fruits to produce juice for sale

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with eight children; three attend school and five have already graduated. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

For the past ten years, she has operated a food stall, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her major dream is to expand her business.

With a Kshs 35,000 loan, she wants to purchase cereals, oil and potatoes.  Amina decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cereals, oil and potatoes.

loans.name: Dushyirehamwe Kzr Group

texts.fr:
Oswald fait partie du groupe Dushyirehamwe/KZR. Le nom du groupe signifie « mettons nous ensemble ». Il a 38 ans et il est marié avec 6 enfants de 2 à 11 ans, dont 4 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est 8 ans de primaire. 

Oswald est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 


Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser les semences sélectionne de riz et récolter une grande quantité. Dans les prochaines années, Oswald voudrait être parmi les meilleurs cultivateurs de riz dans sa vallée. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer ses enfants et les soignes.
texts.en:
Oswald is part of the group called Dushyirehamwe/KZR. The name of the group means "let's come together". Oswald is 38 and married with eight children ranging from 2 to 11 years old, of whom 4 are enrolled in school. His own educational level is eight years of primary school. 

Oswald grows rice. This is his first loan from ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy chemical fertilizer for his rice crop. 

His strategy for the growth of his business is to use selected varieties of rice and harvest a large quantity. In the coming years, Oswald would like to be among the best rice growers in his valley. With the profits he intends to educate and care for his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer for his rice crop.

loans.name: Mehrikhon

texts.ru: Мехрихон трудолюбивая и ответственная  женщина. Она занимается куплей абрикосовых ядер и продает их с наценкой 10% в основном на рынке сухофруктов. Муж Мехрихон в России, у нее три несовершеннолетних детей. Они помогают ей в сортировке сухофруктов, когда начинается сезон. Муж Мехрихон переводит с России  деньги семье, на эти деньги она купила дом. Мехрихон заботливая мать и жена она помогает мужу тем, что обеспечивает семью. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес, поэтому она хотела бы получить займ в размере 1000$ США. Мехрихон благодарит за понимание и поддержку.
texts.en: Mehrikhon is a hard-working and responsible woman.  She buys apricot kernels and sells them at a 10% add-on primarily at a dried fruits market.  Her husband is in Russia, and they have three adolescent children.  They help Mehrikhon with sorting dried fruits during the season.  Mehrikhon's husband wires money to the family from Russia, and Mehrikhon bought a house with this money.  She is a caring mother and wife, and she helps her husband by providing for the family.  She wants to expand her business and wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $1000 for this purpose.  Mehrikhon is grateful for the understanding and support.

loans.use: to buy apricot kernels

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man who has 5 children ranging from 8 to 24 years old.  He describes himself as efficient and trustworthy. 

He operates a metal shop where he makes and sells gates, doors and windows.  He has been involved in this business for 2 years and employs 2 staff members. 

He says his biggest business challenge is financial.  He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase steel to grow his business and to meet the demands of customers. His goal is to grow into a big welding business.  Joseph also plans to purchase a plot of land in the future.

loans.use: to buy steel.

loans.name: Neptali

texts.en:
Neptali is 49 years old and lives in Oroquieta City. She is married with 4 children. 

To earn a living, Neptali sells items like canned goods, soft drinks, vegetables oil, sugar, cigarettes and more.  She earns about PHP 7,00 each month. 

Neptali has requested a loan to purchase more stock for her general store.  She has been a member of PMPC for a year.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 26 years old, married and a mother of two children. 

Iman has been a tailor since 2007; she is an owner of a workshop where she makes, repairs or alters clothing professionally, and especially suits and women’s clothing. She has more than five years experience in this field. She has a deep understanding of local customers and knows about their needs. She has a good reputation and she is well known in her surroundings.

She is requesting a $1800 loan in order to purchase an electric diesel generator, a split air conditioner and a sewing machine .She is aiming to gain more profits to offer her the opportunity to provide a better life for her family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase an electric diesel generator, split air conditioner, and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Tessia

texts.en: Tessia is a 29-year-old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 8 to 12 years. She describes herself as social. She operates a retail store where she sells drinks and food. She has been involved in this business for 7 years and employs 3 staff members. Her business is located in a densely-populated area of town. She will use the KES 45,000 loan to purchase cereal to sell. Her business goal is to purchase some tailoring equipment within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to open a tailoring school.

loans.use: To purchase cereal to sell

loans.name: Lulalane

texts.en:
Lulaine has been operating her retail store for four years and she is glad because her business is improving and growing. She is able to earn about P4,500 a month and uses her profit to pay for her family's electric bills and daily needs. 

Lulaine suffered difficulties in her business due to many unpaid credit from her customers. She is requesting for a loan in the amount of P30,000 to allow her to buy groceries such as soft drinks, assorted biscuits, eggs, cooking oil, baked breads and other items for her retail shop business. She hopes to obtain this loan so that she can improve her family's living condition.

loans.use: buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn Group

texts.en:
Jocelyn is married and has three children.  She is 49 years old and lives in Disud, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte.  She is the leader of a 3 person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

To earn a living, Jocelyn sells canned goods and other daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, oil, soy sauce, softdrinks, etc.  She has had this business for 1 year.  Each month, she earns 1,500 PHP from this type of work. Jocelyn has requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to purchase soap, shampoo, toothpaste, softdrinks and other products for her store.

Jocelyn has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, she hopes to make her sari-sari store bigger and help her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy daily use products to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 37 years old and a single mother of one.  She sells auto spare parts so as to earn a living.  She has been in the business for eight years.  She has employed one person to assist her in the business. 

 Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has improved her business.  Her dream is to open other outlets of her business in the future.  She has requested 90,000 Kenya shillings to add to her stock of spare parts.

loans.use: To add to her stock of spare parts.

loans.name: Sanona

texts.ru: Санона проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 40 лет. Разведена. У нее двое детей. Она рядом с домом открыла ларек, где продает продукты питания и газеты. Санона два года как занимается торговлей. Кредит берет для покупки колбасных изделий, газированных напитков и канцелярских товаров.
texts.en: Sanona lives in the town of Tursun-zoda.  She is 40 years old, divorced and has two children.  She opened a small store near her home, where she sells food products and newspapers.  Sanona has been involved in sales for two years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of sausage products, carbonated drinks and office supplies.

loans.use: to purchase of sausage products, carbonated drinks and office supplies.

loans.name: Agustina Group

texts.en:
Agustina is married and has 9 adult children. She is 50 years old and lives in Tabid, Ozamis City.  She is the leader of a 5-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

Agustina operates a grocery store to earn a living.  She has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 5000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 3000 PHP to purchase grocery items such as canned goods to sell.  

Agustina has been a member of PMPC for 1 month. In the future, she hopes to save money for the future.

loans.use: buy grocery items to sell

loans.name: Domingga

texts.en:
Domingga is married and has 5 adult children.  She is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines.  

Domingga is a farmer and specializes in rice production to earn a living.  She has been doing this for 20 years.  She has requested a loan of 7000 PHP to purchase fertilizer for her business. 

Domingga has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, she hopes to buy another plot of land to increase her rice production.

loans.use: buy fertilizer for her rice farm

loans.name: Dorcus Mutune

texts.en:
Dorcus is a married woman.  She has 3 children with ages ranging from 7 years to 13 years. She describes herself as creative, jovial, and aggressive. 

Dorcus operates a grocery and retail store where she sells avocados, cabbages, tomatoes, potatoes, flour, tea and chapati. She has been involved in this business for 1.5 years. Her business is located in a commercial area near a primary school and her primary customers are men. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of food. She will use the Kes 15,000 loan to purchase flour, tomatoes, potatoes and cabbages.  Her business goal is to have a more stocked retail shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to educate her children to a high level of education.

loans.use: buy flour, tomatoes, potatoes and cabbages

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a businessman who operates a retail shop.  He started the business in 2003 and has employed one person.  Besides, he is employed.  He has grown the business with his previous loans from Faulu Kenya.  He hopes to expand the business into wholesale in the future.

Peter has requested 70,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, maize flour and cooking fat.

loans.use: To buy sugar, maize flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara is a 54-year-old mother of four. Now that her children are grown she is investing her time in developing her business. After years of working to get out of debt, Sara is seeing new possibilities for her future. Sara designs and creates wedding dresses. Recently she was approached by a major Israeli department store to showcase one of her designs. This gives her an extra outlet to sell. Sara creates the dresses from her home and wants to continue to do so. She has no intention of opening a shop but does want to strengthen ties with shops to sell her products. 

Sara needed this loan to purchase cloths, materials, supplies and additional tailoring services for her dresses to meet customer orders.  In the future, she wants to invest in advertising to increase her sales and client base.

loans.use: purchase materials for wedding dresses

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
This borrower is Hussein. He is from Iraq. He is 50 years old and the married and father for two children, both of whom work. Hussein lives with his wife, children, and another family member. Since 2006, Hussein has owned a bakery where he produces and sells flour-based oven-baked food such as bread, cakes, pastries, and pies. He has more than five years experience in this field and has a good reputation. Hussein's bakery is situated in a crowded area where there are a good number of customers passing by.

Hussein is requesting a 2,400 USD loan to purchase a large dough machine and an electric diesel generator. His aim is to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a dough machine and a generator

loans.name: Duhaninkunga Group

texts.fr:
Johnson fait partie du groupe Duhaninkunga. Le nom du groupe signifie «let’s support ourselves». Il a 31 et il est marié avec 3 enfants de 6 à 11 ans, dont 3 scolarisés.son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de primaire. 

Johnson est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques et payer la main d’œuvre pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’agrandir la surface à  cultiver pour récolter beaucoup plus. Dans les prochaines années, Johnson voudrait être parmi les meilleurs cultivateurs de riz dans sa vallée. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer ses enfants et les soigner.
texts.en:
Johnson is part of the group called Duhaninkunga. The name of the group means «let’s support ourselves». He is 31 and married with eight children ranging from 6 to 11 years of age, of whom 3 are enrolled in school. His own level of education is six years of primary school. 

Johnson grows rice. This is his first loan with ACB. He intends to use his loan to buy chemical fertilizer and pay for labor for his rice crop. 

His strategy for the growth of his business is to expand his arable land so as to reap a lot more. In the coming years, Johnson would like to be among the best growers of rice in his valley. With the profit, he intends to educate and care for his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer and pay for labor for his rice fields.

loans.name: Marcel

texts.en:
Marcel worked for over 15 years as a physical therapist with handicapped and disabled adults. Her work was physically demanding, and after suffering a back injury she could not go back to this field. Instead of giving up she decided to develop a business activity. She started selling jewelry, handbags and cosmetics that she bought and restyled from her home. Marcel was able to sell items even cheaper than available at the souk market.

Marcel needed this loan to renovate her workstation and purchase additional stock.  She dreams of continuing to branch out into additional items and utilizing her sewing and artistic skills. One day she wants to open a store on the main street of her village and broaden her business' potential.

loans.use: renovate her workstation and purchase stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: renovate her basket weaving shop and display shelves

loans.name: Alma Elcarte's Group

texts.en:
Alma is married and has 4 school-aged children.  She is 42 years old and lives in Malaubang, Ozamiz City.

Alma sells pork barbeque to earn a living and has had this business for 2 years. She has requested a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase ingredients like pork and sauce.

Alma has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business to the neighboring town in Ozamiz.

loans.use: buy pork and bbq sauce to make food for sale

loans.name: Remedio

texts.en:
This is Remedio.  He is 50 years old and is a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. He is married to Jesselyn, a caregiver and mother to their three children. Their eldest child is already in high school while the other two are still staying at home. Remedio, together with his wife, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Remedio operates a rolling store. His rolling store is basically a small household product store, which retails plastic containers, dippers, pails, plastic flowers and basins to the local neighborhood. He drives his rolling store within the local community to sell the products. He earns profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of Php 800 in sales every day.

To help him continue the operations of his business, Remedio is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy pails, plasticware, hangers, clothes pins, plastic flowers and other items to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Remedio hopes that his business will continue to be successful and dreams to have a permanent store. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy plasticware

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is married with five school-aged children. She is 36 years old and lives in Tinago, Ozamis City.
Letecia sells fertilized duck eggs (balut) to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 4000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase tricycle use for transportation for the selling of her balut business. 
Letecia has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Letecia hopes to send her children to college so they can have their own business.

loans.use: to purchase tricycle use for transportation for the selling of her balut business

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 44-year-old married man who has five children. He owns a butcher shop and is able to provide for his children. Patrick also farms to supplement his income. Previously, he operated motorbike transport business. Patrick has improved both his business and standard of living through Faulu Kenya. 

Patrick is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to buy cows for slaughter.

loans.use: to buy cows for slaughter

loans.name: Buya

texts.en:
Buya is a divorced man who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is the high cost of transportation. For the past six months, he has operated a business selling goats at the market and from home to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in his business. He dreams of purchasing more goats in the future.

With this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan, he wants to purchase more goats for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for resale.

loans.name: Jecel Group

texts.en: Jecel has a sari-sari (general store) business and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She is 27 years old and lives in P-1 Cogon, Ozamiz City. She is married with three children. Jecel has a requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, cigarettes, sacks of rice, etc. Jecel has been a member of PMPC for 6 months. In the future, she hopes to be successful in her chosen business. Jecel is the leader of a two person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase products for her business.

loans.name: Saniya

texts.en:
Saniya is 21 years old and lives in the town of Wobulenzi in the Luwero region of Uganda. For the past 5 years, Saniya has been working hard to manage her restaurant, which provides an outside catering service to local families and businesses. 

To help expand her business, Saniya has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase flour and cooking oil, and will help Saniya to generate greater profits and pay her children's school fees. Saniya hopes that in the future she will be able to own a house. 

Saniya is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Saniya's future prospects by helping her to improve her business knowledge.

loans.use: to purchase flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Esther Wanjiku

texts.en: Esther is a 50-year-old married woman. She has 6 children with ages ranging from 20 to 30 years. She describes herself as honest and reliable. She operates a grocery store where she sells bread, milk, sugar, flour, and tea leaves. She has been involved in this business for 9 years. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add to the stock of sugar and flour of the business. Her business goal is to have a mini supermarket within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to build more rental houses.

loans.use: To purchase stock of sugar and flour

loans.name: Abdel Rida

texts.en:
This borrower is Abdel Rida. He is from Iraq. Abdel Rida is 57 years old and is married. He lives with his wife and two children, both of whom work. Since 2005, Abdel Rida has owned a workshop where he repairs and paints autos and also works as a blacksmith. He repairs and fixes all types of cars. Abdel Rida has a great deal of experience in this field and has a good reputation. He is well-known in his surroundings.

Abdel Rida  is requesting a 3,000 USD loan purchase automobile equipment and tools for his workshop. His aim is to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase automobile equipment and tools

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 38 years old. She is married and has three children. She runs a retail shop to earn a living. She has operated this business for seven years. She has retained her business because she has managed to increase her business stock with her previous loans from Faulu Kenya. She also does some farming for extra income. Beatrice dreams of expanding into a wholesale business in the future. She needs 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sugar, cooking fat, and maize flour.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking fat, and maize flour.

loans.name: Abajyamugambi N.3 Group

texts.fr:
Bénédigito fait partie du groupe Abajyamugambi No 3. Le nom du groupe signifie « people in agreement of development ». Il a 48 et il est marié avec 7 enfants de 3 à 20 ans, dont 5 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Bénédigito est cultivateur de riz. C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser des engrais chimiques et semence sélectionné pour augmenter la production. Dans les prochaines années, Bénédigito voudrait être le meilleur cultivateur de riz dans sa vallée. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigne ses enfants.
texts.en:
Bénédigito is part of the Abajyamugambi no. 3 group. The name of the group means "people in agreement of development". He is 48 years old and married with seven children between 3 and 20 years old, five of whom are at school. He had six years of primary education.

Bénédigito grows rice. This is his second loan from ACB and he is going to use it to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming.

To expand his business he is planning to use chemical fertilizers and selected seeds to increase production. In the coming years, Bénédigito would like to become the best rice farmer in his valley. With the profits he makes he plans to educate and look after his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a married woman with seven children; five attend school, while two are still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

For the past five years, Riziki has been selling charcoal and firewood to local residents in her area. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuations in her business. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers’ needs in the future.

With this 100,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to purchase bundles of firewood and charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood and charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Almasi Group

texts.en:
Victoria, who is in her late thirties, is married with five children, four of whom go to school. She has been working as a tailor and selling fabrics since 2006. She works from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, and she wants to use it to buy more fabrics and materials for making more dresses. Her dream is to one day be able to open a big shop where she can put more sewing machines and good tailors.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Almasi" which has a total of 19 members, who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics and materials for making more dresses.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
This is Cesar, 52, resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. He is married to Fe, a church worker and the mother of their only child, who is now studying in high school. Cesar, together with his wife, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Cesar manages a drafting services business. He offers drafting and other school art project services to students and other customers who need his service. He earns by charging the students a fee for every project that he is doing. He earns a minimum of 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from the services he provides every week.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy drafting materials and other school supply items that he uses in his business. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Cesar hopes that his business will continue to be successful and dreams to have a permanent place for his business. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week. Here he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional drafting and school supply items he needs in his business

loans.name: Jenipher

texts.en:
Jenipher is a 35-year-old married woman. She has one child, age 3, for whom she hopes to provide good education to the university level. She describes herself to be religious and customer friendly. 

Jenipher operates a pharmacy, where she sells medicine to the local people in Mombasa. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located within a shopping center. She describes her biggest business challenge to be competition, leading to decreased sales volume. She will use the 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) loan to purchase medicine. Her business goal is to grow it to wholesale in the future.

loans.use: To buy medicine.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 16 years old and lives in the town of Wobulenzi in the Luwero region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Christine has been working hard to manage her small hotel, which serves mainly as a local restaurant. 

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase sauce pans and cups, and will help Christine to generate greater profits and pay her school fees. Christine hopes that in the future she will be able to become an accountant. 

Christine is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Christine's future prospects by helping her to work hard at building her business.

loans.use: to purchase sauce pans and cups.

loans.name: Elipin

texts.en:
Elipin is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the last ten years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from her home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other clothes sellers in the area. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the 40,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is a married woman with seven children, six of whom attend school while one is too young for school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of family basic needs. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and water. 

Rachael has operated a retail shop for the past three years, and her clients are the local area customers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality, where the demand is high only during the end of the month. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 40,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase ten bundles of maize flour. She decided to join Yehu because of easy access of loans.

loans.use: To purchase ten bundles of maize flour.

loans.name: Outhman

texts.en:
Outhman is a 47-year-old married man, and a father of five children. He lives with his beloved family in Ain, and he has worked as a blacksmith for the last 30 years. Outhman is a hardworking man, and he is trusted and recommended by most of his customers. Most of his customers are from his village, and his business is highly requested in his region.

Outhman is professional in his business. This is his first time to request a loan from Al Majmoua, which he will use to buy specially priced iron pillars necessary to improve his business.

Outhman works hard on improving his business, to insure continuity and to improve his family's social and financial situations.

loans.use: To buy necessary iron for his business.

loans.name: Abduchabbor

texts.ru: Абдучаббор житель города Куляб. Возраст, 22 года. Холост. Живет вместе с родителями. У него среднее образование. Абдучаббор три года как занимается развозками. Он предоставляет услугу, такси. Кредит берет для ремонта автомобиля, чтобы обеспечить безопасную услугу.
texts.en: Abdujabbor lives in the town of Kulob.  He is 22 years old, single and lives together with his parents.  He has a secondary education.  Abdujabbor has been involved in transportation for three years.  He provides and taxi service.  He is requesting this loan to make repairs to his car, so that he can provide a safe service.

loans.use: to make repairs to his car

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a married man with six children, five boys and one girl. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food, clothing and school fees.

For the past ten years, he has operated a hand cart business, operating from home to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of competition from other hand cart operators in the area. He dreams of establishing a charcoal selling business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to start a charcoal selling business with the purchase of six sacks of charcoal for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To start a charcoal selling business with the purchase of six sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Ludivina is 56 years of age and married with three children. 

Ludivina runs her store within the village of San Manuel San Mateo. She has had this business for one year, because her first business is a transport motorcycle. Aside from her store and transportation business she is also engaged in agriculture, particularly a fishpond business. Ludivina is grateful for all the blessings she has at this time. 

She is aiming to increase her profits due to expensive basic commodities and high electric bills. So, for these reason, she is asking for financial assistance in the amount of P20,000 to be used in buying additional groceries such as canned goods, soft drinks, cooking oil, ingredients, instant noodles and biscuits for her grocery store. She believes that she can improve her store and other businesses through the loan amount she requested. 

Ludivina expects that she could be a successful businesswoman someday. In addition, she believes that her patience and hard work will provide a better result in achieving her goal in life.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as canned goods, soft drinks, cooking oil, instant noodles and biscuits for her grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medicine.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is 19 years old and lives in the town of Wobulenzi in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past 3 years, Edith has been working hard to manage her small farm, which grows fresh produce that Edith then sells at her food stall. 

To help expand her business, Edith has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase seeds, and will help Edith to generate greater profits and provide for her family's basic needs. Edith hopes that in the future she will be able to become a big business women. 

Edith is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Edith's future prospects by helping her to improve her business knowledge.

loans.use: to purchase seeds to grow fresh produce she sells at her food stall

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Sauda is a married woman with five children, four girls and one boy. Two of her children attend school while three graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. 

For the past seven years she has operated a food stall business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of competition from other food stall operators in the area. Sauda dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase building materials to expand her premises. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase building materials to expand her premises

loans.name: Akiba Group

texts.fr: La cliente Sifa, leader du groupe d’affaire «Akiba », est  jeune entrepreneur, âgée de 34  ans, mariée, mère de 5 jeunes enfants, qui étudient tous à l’école primaire. Son mari est un mécanicien. Elle est  sociétaire d’une boucherie, vendeuse de viande. Il y a 8 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir le tout premier  crédit de Hekima. Son premier capital fut  reçu de son mari. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  une chèvre à abattre.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement  et agrandir son entreprise.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en: The client Sifa is leader of the group "Akiba" and is a young entrepreneur aged of 34. She is married and mother of 5 children who are all going to middle school. Her husband is a garage mechanic. She is a member of a butchery that sells meat. She does income generation activities such like this one for 8 years. However, she just received her first loan from Hekima. Her first capital was given by her husband. This new loan will allow her to buy a goat to slaughter. Moreover, she hopes to see her children growing in a comfortable environment and to expand her business. Sifa thanks Hekima for their actions toward poor women left out of the traditional banking system.

loans.use: To buy a goat

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
This is Annabelle, 35, resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Danny, a security guard, and mother to their three children. The oldest child is in high school while the youngest is still staying at home. By the grace of God, she has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Annabelle oversees the operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. In her business the regular customers are the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 300 every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and accessories, and also for the maintenance of her motorcycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Annabelle dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and were she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts, accessories and maintenance of her tricycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy hair weaves and other hair additions

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en: Miriam is 46 years old and a businesswoman who runs a retail shop. She has been in this business for nine years. She has retained the business because of her hard work and determination. She also depends on her husband's financial support for the business. Previously, she operated a boutique. Miriam hopes to open other outlets of her business in the future. She has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy maize flour, bread, and sugar.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, bread, and sugar.

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en:
Kevin is 19 years old and lives in the town of Wobulenzi in the Luwero region of Uganda. For the past year, Kevin has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells cooking goods. 

To help expand her business, Kevin has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase sugar and cooking oil, and will help Kevin to generate greater profits and pay her school fees. Kevin hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Kevin is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Kevin's future prospects by helping her to improve her business knowledge.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Tuzamurane Muhinzi Group

texts.fr:
Daniel fait partie du groupe Tuzamurane/Muhinzi. Le nom du groupe signifie « Improve ourselves ». Il a 46 ans et il est marié avec 9 enfants de 4 à 22 ans, dont 4 scolarisés. 

Daniel est cultivateur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser les semences sélectionnées afin de récolter beaucoup plus. Dans les prochaines années, Daniel voudrait être parmi les meilleurs cultivateurs de riz dans sa vallée. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Daniel is part of the Tuzamurane/Muhinzi group. The name of the group means "improve ourselves". He is 46 years old and married with nine children, whose ages range from four to 22 years old; four of the children are at school.

Daniel is a rice farmer. This is his second loan from ACB and he is going to use it to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming.

In order to grow his business, he is planning to use selected seeds so that he can harvest a lot more. In the years to come, Daniel would like to be among the best rice farmers in his valley. With the profits he makes he is planning to educate and care for his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming activity

loans.name: Radwan

texts.en:
Radwan is a 47 year-old married man.  He has worked in the wood business for 20 years. This long experience was sufficient to help in educating and raising his five children in a good environment.

Radwan is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to buy new machines necessary to improve his business, and to improve his living situation by building an additional room onto his house.

Radwan is a very talented man.  His business is strong enough to insure that the requested loan will help a lot in improving both his social and financial situation.

loans.use: To buy new machines necessary to improve his business

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
This is Gemma, 34, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Tito, a driver, and is the mother of her only child who is now studying in elementary school. Gemma, together with her husband and child, manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Gemma maintains a direct-selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through popular direct-selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange. A customer’s order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and the difference provides the profit that dealers are investing in as their income. Gemma's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 1100 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php20000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy merchandise and orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Gemma hopes to be successful in her business and dreams of giving her child a good and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 21 years old and lives in the town of Wobulenzi in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, with one of them currently in school. For the past 2 years, Lilian has been working hard to manage her salon, which does specialty cuts and hairdressing for local women. 

To help expand her business, Lilian has requested a loan of 350,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy supplies for hair extensions and braids, and will help Lilian to generate greater profits and take care of herself. Lilian hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Lilian is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Lilian's future prospects by helping her to improve her business knowledge.

loans.use: to buy supplies for hair extensions and braids

loans.name: John

texts.en: This is John, who is 37 years old and single. He uses his bicycle to transport cakes and bread to distribute to retail shops. He has engaged in this business for five years. He has improved his business since he joined Faulu Kenya because he has been trained in business management skills. John hopes to expand his business in the future to earn more income. He has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy wheat flour and cooking fat for baking bread and cakes.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour and cooking fat for baking bread and cakes.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is a married Kenyan lady with five children. She lives in the Dandora estate in Nairobi where her business of selling new inner wear (underwear) is located. Her customers are mostly ladies within the Dandora estate. She has been in business for fifteen years.

Her future hopes are to grow her business to wholesale and give a good life to her children. Her challenges are when the customers buy on credit they disappear and also the lack of capital. Hannah is honest and religious.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
This is Estella, 34, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. Separated from her husband, she manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Estella maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange and other direct selling brands. A customer’s order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 3,000 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 16,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Estella hopes to be able to be successful in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Mjeni

texts.en:
Mjeni is a married woman with seven children, four of whom attend school while three are too young for school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

She has operated a charcoal selling business for the past three years. Her potential clients are the local community members. She faces a major challenge of transportation. She dreams of expanding in the future.

With the 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase ten bags of charcoal. She decided to join Yehu to access loans.

loans.use: to purchase ten bags of charcoal

loans.name: Rachabi

texts.ru: Рачаби проживает в районе Дангара. Ей 51 год. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Ее дети работают и живут отдельно. Сама она занимается торговлей. Она у себя дома открыла маленький магазин, где продает продукты питания. Кредит берет для покупки печенья, сахара, конфет, растительного масла, газированных напитков, натуральных соков и шоколада.
texts.en: Rachabi lives in the town of Dangara.  She is 51 years old, married and has four children.  Her children work and lives separately.  Rachabi is involved in sales.  She opened a small store at home, where she sells food products.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of cookies, sugar, candy, vegetable oil, carbonated drinks, natural juices and chocolate.

loans.use: to purchase of cookies, sugar, candy, vegetable oil, carbonated drinks, natural juices and chocolate.

loans.name: Boresha Group

texts.en:
Penina is in her mid 30s, married, and has five children who attend school.  She has been running a business of selling eggs and milk door to door since 2006.  She works from 6 a.m to noon daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

Penina is requesting her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to buy more eggs and better cow feeds to feed her cow so that it produces more milk to sell.  Her dream is to enroll her children in good schools.

Penina will share this loan with her loan group Boresha, which has a total of 15 members who hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh eggs and buy better cow feeds.

loans.name: Crispus

texts.en:
Crispus is a married man with five children, four boys and one girl. His wife is a businesswoman operating a vegetable stall business which contributes to the family's source of livelihood. He lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past one year he has operated a plumbing business. He operates from home where his neighbours and passersby are the potential customers. He faces a major challenge of competition from other plumbers in the area. He dreams of establishing a vegetable stall business in the future.

With the 20,000 KES, he wants to purchase stock for his wife’s business, sacks of vegetables from greengrocers in the area. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables from greengrocers in the area

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 23 year old single man. He has been working as a blacksmith since 1995.

Ahmad is a hardworking man with good reputation. Most of his clients like dealing with him because of the honest verbal agreements he makes. He is highly recommended by most of his clients, who are from his village. His business is highly requested in his region.

Ahmad is professional in his business, this is his first time to request a loan from Al Majmoua. He has to buy buy necessary tools for his business.

Ahmad is working hard to improve his business through updating his machinery to do the requested work in a very short time with the best quality. Ahmad hopes to have a small family in the future. To ensure his family's good social and financial situation, he works hard for his business continuity.

loans.use: to buy the necessary tools for his business.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
This is Analyn, 29, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She’s married to William, a driver, and mother to their two children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Analyn is a rice dealer. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling per sacks or per kilo. Aside from the rice, she also earns by selling fruit. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 450 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 24,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy sacks of rice, and fruit for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Analyn hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work at her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. She can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of rice and fruit for her business.

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is 43 years old, married, and has six children.  She runs a retail shop and has been doing so for 10 years.  She also does farming to improve her standard of living.  

Beth is requesting a loan for 30,000 KES, which she will use to buy cereals, sugar, and maize flour. Through Faulu Kenya, she has improved her business, which has helped her to pay school fees for her children. Beth hopes to open other outlets of her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cereals, sugar, and maize flour.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
This is Marivic, 38, a resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Rodel, a stock man, and a mother to their two children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and to support her children’s schooling. 

Marivic operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages, piecemeal, to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 19,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Marivic dreams to grow her business in the coming years, just as she fervently hopes that her child will be able to graduate one day, and finish his studies. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 34 years old, married and has three children. He runs a motorbike transport business to earn a living. He has been in the business for three years and has employed one person. Previously, he used to farm. Through Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his money and access loans easily.
Moses hopes to buy a lorry for his transport business within five years. He has requested 20,000 Kenya shillings to repair his motorbike.

loans.use: To repair his motorbike

loans.name: Ripka

texts.en:
