Ripka is a 47-year-old lady who originated from Ambon. She is married to Marthen, a 48-year-old man. From their marriage, Ripka and Marthen are blessed with three children. They are:
 	Kristin, 20 years old, 
 	Alwin, 16 years old, 
 	Lodowik, 11 years old.
Both Alwin and Lodowik are still at school.

Since she got married, Ripka spends her time as a housewife as well as a farmer. She plants bitter melon, tomatoes, cucumber, "kangkung", eggplant, etc. After the vegetables are harvested, Ripka will sell them to customers nearby the village and surroundings. She spends the income to meet their daily needs and to buy seed, petrol, and fertilizer. 

Ripka has a dream to plant various vegetables on the farm but she only has limited capital. Therefore, Ripka is requesting a loan of IDR 5,000,000 from TLM. She plans to use the loan to purchase vegetable seed, fertilizer, pesticide and petrol for the tractor. She is hoping that TLM is willing to assist her through the loan.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable seed, fertilizer, pesticide and petrol for the tractor.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
This is Gina, 40, a resident of Baseco, Manila, Philippines. She is mother to her four children. She, together with her children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continue to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Gina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages, piecemeal, to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Aside from this she also earns additional income from RTW and accessories that she sells. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 42,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other merchandise to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Gina hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her children a good future and a high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 37-year-old married man living with his wife and two children. He has been working as a freelance construction worker for the past 24 years. His job is specialized, in painting walls and ceilings. During his career, Mohamad has been able to work closely with multiple construction projects and he is strong enough to finish several projects at the same time.

Mohamad's wife supports him a lot through taking good care of their house and children. She also manages their household expenses. Today, Mohamed is asking to borrow a loan, from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy a new Renault Rapid car. The car is a necessity for his business to transport his tools from one project to another. The loan would also increase his ability to purchase construction tools and supplies for a new project he is planning to do. 

Mohamad is going to sell his old car, because it's causing him more maintenance costs. He has a real need to get extra money in order to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a car necessary for his business, in addition to increasing his construction tools and supplies.

loans.name: Daud

texts.en:
Daud is a 47-year-old man and is married to Nelcy, a 44-year-old lady. From their marriage, they have 6 lovely children named: Mikael, 17 and studying at the first grade of Senior High School; Vivi, 15 and studying at the third grade of Junior High School; Auzinta, 12;  Olita, 10 and  Ademance, 7; three of them are attending Elementary School; and Melinda, 1 year old. 

To support his family, Daud runs a furniture business. He has been running the business for six years. Prior to operating the business, Daud used to work as a construction worker for several years but he decided to quit and tried different work as a carpenter. After working for six months he then tried to initiate his own business. He creates various kinds of furniture such as cupboards, desks, tables, chairs, beds, doors, windows and also coffins. 

Daud also employs six workers to assist him. They produce the furniture based on orders from customers. Currently, Daud has received orders from customers that require him to buy more materials. Unfortunately, Daud does not have enough money to buy them as the customers usually pay him in installments.

Therefore, Daud would like to request a loan of IDR 10,000,000 to purchase some beams of hard wood. Daud is expecting that TLM is willing to assist his business.

loans.use: to purchase some beams of hard wood.

loans.name: Andrush

texts.ru:
Андрюша родился в 1954 г. в городе Капане, окончил среднюю школу деревни Цав (Tsav); после школы окончил Ереванский Зооветеринарный институт. В данный момент работает на Капанском рынке контролером мясных продуктов. 
Жена Андрюши домохозяйка, старший сын работает в футбольном клубе “Гандзасар” массажистом, а младший сын играет в том же футбольном клубе. 
Уже более 10 лет Андрюша занимается сельским хозяйством параллельно со своей работой контролером. Ферма Андрюши находиться в деревне Шишкерт, где они с женой выращивают картофель и яблоки, а также занимаются пчеловодством. 
Полученную сельскохозяйственную продукцию, в том числе и высококачественный мед, Андрюша реализует на Капанском городском рынке. 
Андрюше необходим кредит на сумму 300.000 драм для ремонта ульев, покупки рамок для них, а также для приобретения новых сортов картофеля.
Данный кредит является третьим по счету, получаемым Андрюшей от организации Нор Оризон.
texts.en: Andrush was born in 1964 in the town of Kapan.  He completed a secondary school in the Tsav village and graduated from the Yerevan Veterenary Institute afterwards.  Currently, he works at the Kapan market as a meat products quality controller.  Andrush's wife is a homemaker, his oldest son works as a massage therapist at the "Gandzasar" football club, and his youngest son plays for this same football club.  Andrush has been involved in agriculture parallel to his controller work for over 10 years.  Andrush's farm is located in the Shishkert village, where he and his wife grow potatoes and apples and are also involved in beekeeping.  Andrush sells his agricultural products, including high-quality honey, at the Kapan city market.  He needs a loan in the sum 300 000 dram in order to repair beehives, purchase frames for them and also to buy new varieties of potatoes.  This is Andrush's third loan from the Nor Horizon organization.

loans.use: to repair beehives, purchase frames for them and also to buy new varieties of potatoes

loans.name: Solviana

texts.en:
Solviana is a 32-year-old lady; people usually call her "Solvy".  She is married to Ricky, 34 years old. They have been blessed with two children namely: Rista, 10, and studying in the fourth grade of Elementary School and Elki, 8, studying in the third grade of Elementary School.

Solvy originated from Sumatra Island. She is a housewife who has been running an internet stall business for about two years. Her business place is located about 1 km from her house. It is open for business from 09.00 am to 01.00 am. She manages the business together with her husband. 

Solvy is planning to purchase a new computer for her business but she doesn’t have enough capital to do so. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of IDR 5,000,000 from TLM. She hopes that the loan will enable her to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new computer.

loans.name: Immaculate's Group

texts.en:
Immaculate's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Immaculate is 21 years old and lives in the town of Wobulenzi in the Luwero region of Uganda. For the past two years, Immaculate has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells snacks and cooking ingredients. 

To help expand her business, Immaculate has requested a loan of 350,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sugar, and will help Immaculate to generate greater profits and buy food to feed her family. Immaculate hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Immaculate is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Immaculate's future prospects by helping her to improve her business knowledge.

loans.use: to pay for large bags of sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beads for jewelry making

loans.name: Alioune Badara

texts.fr: Gran distributeur de matériaux de construction cet entrepreneur, habitant dans une ville du Sénégal, ce prêt consiste a l'achat de matériaux des bâtiments comme du ciment, des fers et du béton  destiné a la revente. Ce prêt va lui permettre aussi d'augmenter son stock de marchandises vue que ses produits sont trop demandés avec une forte évolution de la construction dans ce secteur. Ayant une expérience de plus de 5 ans dans ce domaine, ce prêt a pour but aussi l'achat d'un terrain destiné a être un entrepôt pour stocker ses marchandises.
texts.en:
This entrepreneur is a wholesaler of construction materials living in a town in Senegal. The loan will serve to purchase construction materials such as cement, iron [balks] and concrete for resale.

This loan will allow him to build up his stock as his goods are in great demand given an expansion of construction work in his region. With over five years of experience in this business, he also intends to   use this loan toward the purchase of a land plot, where he would build a warehouse for storing his goods.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Sintus

texts.en:
Sintus is a 35-year-old man and married to Febi, a 30-year-old lady. They have three kids: Juionto, 9, Seleste, 7, both still at primary school and Tuti, 5, not at school yet. 

Sintus makes a living by being a farmer. His farmland is located about 3 km from his residence. He plants lettuce and cabbage on the farm. The income generated from his own farm is insufficient to fully cover his family needs. Therefore, he also assists other farmers in cultivating their farms and gets paid from the profit. 

Sintus is planning to hire a rice field to cultivate but he doesn’t have money to do so. He then met TLM’s field officer who informed him of TLM’s lending program. He is interested in joining the individual lending program and is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 5,000,000. He wants to hire the rice field to be cultivated for 5 years. He really hopes that TLM will approve his loan application, so he will be able to improve his family's life.

loans.use: to hire a rice field to cultivate.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a married business lady with two children. Her business is a beauty salon, which is located at Dandora Estate in Nairobi. Her customers are ladies, children and men. She says the business is good and her major challenge is customers who do not honor their debts as per the agreement. She is borrowing a loan of KES 20,000 to buy more hair relaxers, treatments and other hair additions, as per customer demands. Her hopes are to have a hair dressing school and her children to have a quality education. Beatrice describes herself as honest and smart.

loans.use: to add hair relaxers, treatments etc.
